name: Strathlyn Coach House Barossa
description:
Please note there is a minimum stay of 2 nights.
Make use of the new Gymnasium and Guest Laundry on the property.
Enjoy the location set among the vineyards.
Conveniently close to the town of Angaston, cafes, restaurants, wineries and bike track.

The space
Strathlyn Coach House is an independent building located at Strathlyn Estate, a privately owned 5 acre historic property located on the fringe of Angaston in the Barossa Valley. The coach house was constructed circa 1905 was restored in 1995 as comfortable accommodation for two. Built of local stone with 30 centimetre walls, the coach house is quite an historic landmark, testifying to life of a bygone era.

The outside of the building remains much the same as it was in 1905, but the interior has been finished with extensive use of timber. A mezzanine level bedroom has been created from the original loft floor.

A large balcony area, reached from the attractive bedroom, has pa
neighborhood_overview: Strathlyn Estate is a very private property surrounded by extensive gardens. It is off the main road located amongst vineyards within walking distance of Saltram Winery. The accommodation is 1 km from Angaston town where guests can access the start of the bike track that runs through the centre of the Barossa Valley to Gawler.
host_location: Barossa Wine Region of South Australia
host_about: I have been a long time resident of the Barossa Valley.I would be happy to provide you with information about local points of interest.

name: Strathlyn Lemon Tree Spa  Barossa
description:
Enjoy the charms of the Barossa Valley in this self contained cottage on the beautiful Strathlyn Estate located just out of Angaston.
If you are on an extended holiday, you have the convenience of a guest laundry on the property and a new Gymnasium.

The space
The Strathlyn Lemon Tree Spa Apartment is a self contained free standing cottage located at Strathlyn Estate, a privately owned 5 acre historic property located on the fringe of Angaston in the Barossa Valley. The cottage provides quality accommodation for one couple, features a large 2 person spa at one end of the bedroom in a tiled area. A spacious living area and TV/DVD and comfortable large sofa encourage relaxation. The well equipped kitchenette is supplied with ample provisions for breakfast.

A separate bathroom has a shower/toilet and vanity. There is an outdoor table setting in a walled area near the pond and garden allowing for outdoor relaxation or meals

Guest access<
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy the tranquility of staying on the beautiful Strathlyn Estate, surrounded on all sides by historic vineyards.
Strathlyn Estate is within walking distance of Saltram Winery and the Farmers Market. The accommodation is 1 km from Angaston town where guests can access the start of the bike track that runs through the centre of the Barossa Valley to Gawler.

name: Strathlyn Spa Garden Suites Barossa
description:
The spa garden suites are located on the eastern side of the main residence at Strathlyn Estate. They are very private with their own access from the garden. They are tastefully and comfortably furnished. Each features a luxury bathroom with spa.

The space
Strathlyn Residence was constructed in 1905 from local Angaston marble. It graces the top of a hill overlooking surrounding vineyards next to the historic Saltram Winery. Originally comprising of 6 bedrooms the house has been extensively renovated. The Strathlyn Spa Garden Suites are tastfully furnished suites in the main residence with their own private entrances from the garden.

Guest access
Guests can access the whole property except the main residence interior.

Other things to note
When first arriving check in at the Reception located on the eastern verandah of the main residence facing the tennis court.

During certain times of the year (harvesting)

name: Shea-Oak Log Studio Shed
description:
Our converted shed is a cozy and comfortable one bedroomed studio with glossy kitchen, granite bench tops, timber floors, shiny bathroom and large carpeted bedroom with a comfy queen bed. The studio has everything you could possibly need to have a wonderful and comfortable stay.
Located in western Barossa, just off the Sturt Hwy, minutes away from Barossa attractions and 50 minutes from Adelaide. Be Consumed-In the Barossa.

The space
The Shea-Oak Log Studio AKA The Shed, is a lovely space. A large double glass sliding door lets the morning sun stream in onto the timber floor. There is 2 leather lounges which seats 5 people with ease. The extra large bedroom has a queen bed and room for a portacot, if needed.
The Studio is set up to fit 2 people with comfort.
The Studio is full insulated and very comfortable in any weather, with 2 air conditioners, portable heater and fans.
The Studio is located at the southern end of our 15 acre property, whi
neighborhood_overview: The Studio is located in a very unique area. There are no close by neighbouring houses, you are moments off of the Sturt Highway which leads you to the heart of the Barossa in 10 minutes and to Adelaide in 50 minutes. The studio is situated at the southern end of our property which is close to the Sturt Highway, this is great for access but you can hear the road noise from the studio. You are surrounded by the Barossa Ranges, vineyards and broadacre crops. No one will bother you here! Only our little miniature schnauzers Hugo and Alfie, who likes to come and say hello from time to time!
host_about:
We are a family of 4 who live, work and play in the Barossa Valley. We live on a small vineyard and make our own wine. We love the big outdoors, camping, the Murray river and doing things as a family. 
We are true locals and know the Barossa inside and out.
We live on the property but are far enough away to not bother you at all and let you enjoy yourselves but close enough if you have any problems.

name: Barossa Valley Apt 1 offers 2 bedrooms 2 bathroom
description:
Luxury apartment on offer right in the heart of the Barossa Valley, Tanunda. 2 bedrooms 2 bathrooms, FREE WIFI, full kitchen with coffee machine, dishwasher, access to laundry, own spa bath, double shower, 1 King bed which can split to 2 singles and 1 queen. Access to swimming pool. Let us tour you as well. Great location to walk to restaurants, cafes and some wineries.

We are also Tour Barossa so would love to help with all your wine touring needs, airport transfers and restaurant.

The space
Our luxury apartments are locate in a fantastic location right in Tanunda, the heart of the Barossa Valley. Children are very welcome to stay at our property, and can provide cot's and highchairs, also a pram if needed (upon prior request) Tanunda has some wonderful restaurants, cafes and some great wineries to walk to, too. We have 4 apartments to choose from, 2 downstairs offering their own enclosed rear courtyards and 2 upstairs with balconies overlooking the g
neighborhood_overview: Barossa Valley is a beautiful community of people.
host_about: love travel, love creating wonderful experiences, love wine, love food, love my 3 children

name: 2 bedrooms with Woodfire, Barossa Country Cottages
description:
Historic Lyndoch, “The Village of Wine and Roses” is an ideal place from which to experience the famous Barossa Valley. Jacaranda Cottage is a short 800 mtrs from the village. It is self-contained with a cosy wood fire for those cold winter nights.

Guest access
Large shady garden and plenty of free parking space beside your cottage.
Each cottage has a washing machine.
host_about: Hi, We love hosting people at our cottages in the Barossa, both at the 1890s historic Barossa Hills Cottages in Springton, and these two bedroom family cottages at Lyndoch. In February 2022 the previous owners retired, and we have now refreshed the cottages - which are renowned throughout the Barossa as affordable family (& pet!) friendly accommodation.

name: Gawler River Farm B and B.
description:
The comfortable, stylish, large one bedroom apartment is situated on a working sheep farm. Enjoy country life, night stars, birds at dawn. 30 min. to the Barossa Valley, 60 min. Clare Valley, 40 min. Adelaide CBD.
10 min. Gawler Gliding club.

The space
Experience a country stay. Beautiful country outlooks, no traffic noise, clean fresh air.
Very comfortable for 3 adults, with a Queen double and a single bed. Also a three seater lounge and en suite bathroom. A cot is available on request for small children.

Guest access
Guest have access to the garden and veranda areas. Tea, coffee and continental breakfast is provided. In room fridge facilities. Microwave, Kettle and toaster.
Washing machine available upon request.

Other things to note
We are centrally placed to Adelaide, Virginia and the Barossa Valley, Clare Valley wine areas. Angle Vale, Gawler and Two Wells are our nearest towns.
The Gawler G
neighborhood_overview: The Gawler River area is the closest flat farming area to Adelaide. Studded with gum trees the farm land is park like. The view to the East is of the blue Mt Lofty ranges sweeping round to the Barossa Valley.
host_about:
We are a farming couple. Our farm runs stud sheep and we grow cereal crops. Having lived in Gawler River all our lives we have a detailed knowledge of the area, its history and attractions.
We enjoy traveling, meeting people and have many friends around the world. Especially through our long involvement with Rotary Youth Exchange.

name: The Miners Cottage Barossa Valley
description:
The Miners Cottage is beautifully restored with modern comforts and old world charm. Open fire, gorgeous bathroom, comfy bed, peace and quiet, sleeps two. The Miners Barn, right next to the cottage, can be added to your booking to sleep an extra two people. Beautiful views from every aspect.
A booking for four will be in two seperate cottages- two in the Miners Cottage and two in the Barn. They are right next to each other.

The space
The Miners Cottage - sleeps 2. Beautiful stone cottage with one bedroom, open fireplace, sitting room and kitchenette. Modern bathroom with claw foot bath, double shower, underfloor heating and heated towel rail. Deep back veranda overlooks the pool and winter creek. Lovely red gum outdoor table for eating meals. BBQ & outdoor heater. Also have access to the full kitchen and TV sitting room in the Barn


The Miners Cottage Barn - sleeps 2. Old timber on the outside, modern on the inside. One bedroom with ensuite
neighborhood_overview:
Set in rural surrounds on the edge of the Barossa, 7 mins to Lyndoch, 10 mins to Gawler, 15 mins to Tanunda, 30 mins to Angaston.

Tour the wineries, visit the farmers market, eat out, ride the Bike trail, fossick in an antique store...
host_about: Rebecca lives on the property with her husband and their 3 children.  They have a dog, cat, chooks, a duck and a few pet sheep.  Chances are you'll enjoy eggs fresh from the henhouse when you stay at The Miners Cottage!
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm
description:
If you long for a quiet retreat away from the crowds and close to nature, Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm could be for you. Perched on the hills above the North Para River in the south eastern ranges of the Barossa, you will be serenaded with the tweets from native birds, bleets from lambs and mesmerised by stunning sunrises and sunsets.
When the riches of local food and wine are needed, wineries, markets, cheese shops, cafe's and restaurants are just a 10 minute drive.

The space
Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm is a fully-furnished, cosy log cabin on 10 acres located in the Barossa Valley between Angaston and picturesque Eden Valley. The property has a dam, a small flock of resident sheep and a modest crop of raspberries plants.

The Mt McKenzie Raspberry Farm is perched on ‘Mount McKenzie’, located on the eastern edge of the Barossa Valley in the sub-region of Eden Valley famous for its Riesling. Due to the elevation of the property, there are stunning vie
neighborhood_overview:
The beauty of Mt McKenzie is location.
Close to all the facilities that the Barossa Valley offers while giving privacy and independence of a rural property.

name: "The Shed"
description:
At first glance, yes it's a shed. But explore further and you will find an unique Aussie experience, a fully functional self contained room. Shower, toilet and kitchenette. All private and seperate from our house. It's normally used for overnighters by family and friends. Please be open minded in your expectations, it's not the Ritz, Hilton, Taj Mahal but what it is clean, tidy, private affordable accomadation. Single or couple.

The space
Its not the Taj Mahal but its clean tidy and compact. Queen bed. Designed for a couple or single person. Room is insulated with reverse split air conditioning. (ignore the old in wall aircon in photo)

Guest access
The floor plan shows the area which is yours during your stay. As shown this room is part of a shed for which there is an access door but this is locked when the room is in use. The room is fully insulated with air conditioning.

We have self check in set up. Airbnb should supply this i
neighborhood_overview: Our residence is in a quiet street. We have lived at the same address for over 20yrs. We have a very safe neighbourhood and we have a good relationship with our neighbour's.
host_about:
My wife and I regard ourselves as very sociable people. I myself am an avid home brewer and love fine wine and social gatherings. Married since 1992 and have two teenage kids. Born and lived in the Barossa all my life with strong family ties and local knowledge. I work within the wine industry. Enjoy open air concerts, having been to numerous "Day On The Green" concerts. Love all types of music 80's to current day trends.
I have a favourite saying, 
"We are on this planet for a good time not a long time"

name: 1837 Barossa Luxury  Vineyard Cottage S Australia
description:
Beautiful cottage facing vineyard. French provincial style in Lyndoch, fully equipped kitchen, bathroom with spa, 2 showers, 2TVs, outdoor sitting with views of Barossa Ranges and vineyards. Enjoy the beautiful Barossa sunrise from your bedroom and sunset from the William Light Monument Park. Coffee (Nespresso) and tea provided. Stroll around vineyard and watch out for kangaroos and native birds. Wi-Fi included. Tennis court is available to all guests at our cottages.

The space
A whole country house to enjoy and relax. Surrounded by beautiful vineyard and surrounding Barossa ranges. You have your own spa and shower, fully equipped kitchen, lounge room and front verandah to enjoy the views.

Guest access
Guess are welcome to stroll around the vineyard, visit the William Light monument and read the history of Barossa Valley.

Other things to note
Our new restaurant serving Modern Australian cuisine with contrasting styl
neighborhood_overview:
Surrounded by lovely vineyards and wineries, kangaroos and beautiful birds.
A perfect place to relax and enjoy the calmness of the country yet just an hour away from Adelaide. Stroll around the vineyard and enjoy the breathtaking views of the Barossa Ranges. Visit Colonel William Light Monument on the estate.
host_about: I am a Montessori teacher and at present working with children diagnosed with ASD. Love meeting people, friendly and easy going.

name: The Reserve Barossa Valley
description:
Set on 6 private acres of manicured gardens, our Seppeltsfield Road property has amazing views across Shiraz vines from the 6 person spa and plenty of room to roam in the orchid, wineries just over the road or create a feast in the wood fired oven.

The space
When you arrive, you will love, love, love the home... it is so relaxing and casual you will not want to leave

Guest access
We do have a refundable bond prior to access. As you can appreciate you have the entire home to yourself, hence the bond.

Other things to note
The gardens do require attending to, depending on the season it can vary each week.
neighborhood_overview: Everything is very close, winery 50m across the road and 150m, amazing dining experiences 3 minutes by car.  You are surrounded in the best Shiraz vineyards in the world.  Tanunda and Nuriootpa are both 4minutes by car!

name: Barossa Barn Bed & Breakfast
description:
Rustic double story self-contained stone cottage. Perfect for a romantic couple getaway. Centrally located within walking distance to Angaston, or a short drive to restaurants, cellar doors and all local attractions. This cottage offers the quirky, feeling of yesteryear, yet has modern conveniences to make your stay comfortable, welcoming and relaxing.
Your stay includes breakfast daily at a local cafe - Soul with Zest in Angaston.
Minimum 2 night booking is required.

The space
Upstairs is an air-conditioned open plan area which contains a queen four poster bed, modern kitchenette ( limited cooking facilities, small microwave, toaster & kettle). lounge and dining area.
Downstairs features stone walls and slate floors and includes a dressing room, the bathroom with separate shower, claw foot bath and separate toilet.
We include luxuries to make your stay comfortable including, bathroom toiletries (shampoo, conditioner and soap), filtered wa
neighborhood_overview: Situated in the historic town of Penrice, you can enjoy the picturesque walk or short drive to Angastons' cafe's, restaurants, pubs and shopping district.
host_about:
Welcome to Barossa Barn Bed & Breakfast - Penrice, Barossa Valley
We are excited that you are planning a visit to the beautiful Barossa Valley
We would love to share our part of the Barossa with you and look forward to meeting you.

name: Little Para Cottage
description:
Our cottage is hidden away in Tanunda in the heart of the Barossa Valley. It's little - just one cosy bedroom - but in a very handy location just up the road from iconic Tanunda wineries. It has a private garden and undercover off-street parking.

The space
Our cottage is unique because it look old and rustic on the outside but inside it has a modern kitchenette and bathroom, separate lounge with two sofas, cosy furnishings and cable TV. All linen is provided. It is hidden from the road at the back of a half acre block, with vineyards just over the back fence and local wineries in walking distance. Surprisingly its also close to the main street on the edge of the township, and just a 5 minute drive to the town centre. It also has a private garden to relax in which is fully fenced. People like our cottage because it feels like a home away from home.

Guest access
You have the entire cottage and garden to yourself.

Other things
neighborhood_overview: We are on the edge of town in a residential street that feels more rural than township. Houses are on one side, and wineries and few homes on large allotments are on the other side. We are on the winery side!
host_about: We feel very lucky to live and work in the Barossa and hope you will enjoy exploring our region during your stay! We like the rural feel where we live, with vineyards just over our back fence, but we are minutes to the centre of the township. We enjoy our wine and food and the opportunity to relax, so we understand that our guests might just like to be left to do their own thing and enjoy some time out. We like to take short impromptu getaways. Hubby loves his footy and horse-racing hence Foxtel in the cottage for people who may not want to miss a game while away. I enjoy gardening as being surrounded by a natural setting is important to me. If you want recommendations of where to dine out and what to do, we are happy to point you in directions that we have experienced and recommend! Careers in hospitality brought us to the Barossa in 1997... we're still here!

name: Elderton Wines Guest House
description:
Our Guest House is located in Nuriootpa, in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Situated a short walk from the Elderton Wines Cellar Door, this is a great base for any Barossa visit, be it wine tasting, cycling the Nuriootpa to Angaston bike track or indulging in one of the Barossa’s great eateries and restaurants. Continental breakfast provisions are provided. Also included for your stay – two bottles of Elderton wine which can be enjoyed in our Riedel glassware.

The space
The Elderton Guest House offers three large bedrooms, able to accommodate up to six people comfortably one room contains a king bed, one room a queen bed and one room contains two single beds. The Guest House has reverse cycle air conditioning throughout, making it cosy in winter and beautifully cool in the summer.

The kitchen/dining offers a full kitchen, including oven and cooktop, microwave, dishwasher, fridge and sink. Continental breakfast provisions are provided, including Jersey
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy the Barossa experience!

Elderton Guest House is ideally located within a short walking distance of:
Barossa Distillery
Provenance Barossa
Linke’s Central Meat Store – fifth generation butcher and smokehouse
Stein’s Tap House
Penfolds Cellar Door
Barossa Bush Gardens
Nuriootpa to Angaston Bike Trail
Barossa Farmers Market
Ember Pizza House
Barossa Co-Op Fresh Supermarket
Steiny’s Traditional Mettwurst
Vine Inn Barossa Community Hotel
Angas Park Hotel
Vintners Bar & Grill
Linke’s Bakehouse

The townships of Angaston & Tanunda are only a short 10 minute drive away.
host_about: Elderton Wines is a small, family-owned winery, situated in Nuriootpa, in the heart of Australia’s Barossa Valley. Established by Lorraine and Neil Ashmead in 1982 the winery is now managed by the second generation of the Ashmead family, brothers Cameron and Allister. The Ashmead family have enjoyed hosting many visitors over the years, and now offer Guest House accommodation to the public.

name: Cosy 2-bedroom Cottage in the heart of the Barossa
description:
Lovely vineyard views as well as a convenient, central Barossa Valley location. Veritas Cottage is a recently renovated, fully self-contained cottage with loads of character. Guests have full access to this private home owned and operated by winemaker, Rolf Binder and partner, Cynthia. An ideal retreat option for those wanting to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery and tranquility on the 65 acre property, yet with superb access to wineries, restaurants & shopping.

The space
What's special about our place??

Loads of character - this is a great option for those who want to stay in a place that feels very much 'at home'. Items have been thoughtfully chosen to add interest & charm to the property, with plenty of extras that you certainly wouldn't find in a hotel room.

The location is fantastic - nestled on the very edge of Tanunda township, guests enjoy a rural feeling while still having the advantage of being centrally located & conveniently
neighborhood_overview: What's not to love about being in the Barossa?! Beautiful scenery, amazing local food & wine, wonderfully friendly people. It's our little slice of paradise!
host_about:
We love food, wine and travel and really enjoy meeting guests from all over the world that stay on our property. It's also fun to be able to see guests at our cellar door nearby, where we offer wine tastings and tours of the winery.
Rolf Binder winery was established in 1955 and we produce a wide range of white, red and fortified wines, selling into 18 countries around the globe. Our guests can enjoy a special bottle of wine, made by Rolf! Full breakfast provisions highlighting local Barossa produce are also included.
We stay on top of communication with guests to ensure they have an enjoyable stay and also provide lots of useful local knowledge to help plan time in the region.  Our goal is to make guests feel like they have a sense for what it's like to actually live in the Barossa. Stay with us for a unique visit to our beautiful region! 
Cheers, Cynthia & Rolf

name: Pembury Chase Barossa Valley
description:
Pembury Estate built in 1905 is situated on 10 acres. Your room has a comfortable queen bed, is charming & spacious with tall ceilings only 5 minutes walk into historic Angaston in the Barossa Valley.

The space
We are in the heart of the Barossa Valley.
Our home is in a prime location for travelers! Set on the edge of the town of Angaston we live in a 1905 blue stone homestead built for one of the Salter family sons of Saltram wines
Our 10 acre property has 1 acre of vines, we have sheep and alpacas and 2 dogs
You have a lovely large room, a quiet environment, and as hosts we do our best to welcoming you and are sensitive to your privacy need
Our blue stone homestead, has four bedrooms with a kitchen, lounge, combined laundry / large bathroom. It is centrally heated and we find we do not require cooling due to the stone walls, but there is a fan for summer in case we have a heat wave.
We are used to sharing our home with others, as we ha
neighborhood_overview:
Angaston is a quiet heritage town. A town walk is a must.
We are middle of the Barossa Valley close to the famous Barossa Farmers Market that is open every Saturday morning
Though we are set in a beautiful location with views up the valley overlooking vineyards and paddocks with ancient gums. We are only 5 minutes’ walk to a variety of the Barossa's top restaurants, pubs and cafes. As well as the butcher bakery, supermarket and pharmacy.
We are also right next to the walking/bike track that will take you into Angaston, Nuriootpa and now all the way to Gawler.
There are a couple of cellar doors and restaurants in Angaston within walking distance as well as many cellar door options throughout the valley.
Angaston is 8km from Tanunda and 7 km from Nuriootpa
As there is no public transport so a car is a must. Other options are booking a personalised vineyard tour, or utilising the local taxi service.

We have lived in the Barossa for 25 years.

description:
Treasured Memories Cottage offers 3 bedrooms, 1 bathroom walking distance to the main street of Tanunda to visit restaurants/cafes, local shops and a couple of wineries. Circa 1890's stone cottage with spa, open wood fire, all in the heart of the Barossa. We offer 3 bedrooms, 2 kings 2 singles, full kitchen facilities, laundry, enclosed backyard, also ideal for families to enjoy. Complimentary WiFi
Why not book one of our wine and sightseeing tours with our business Tour Barossa/Getaways SA.

The space
There are three bedrooms, the third bedroom requires access from the second bedroom. Children are very welcome to stay at our property, and can provide cot's and highchairs, also a pram if needed (upon prior request) Tanunda has some wonderful restaurants, cafes and some great wineries to walk to, too.

Guest access
Walk to shops, cafes and wineries and brewery, also access to our facilities of arranging our award winning tours to complet
neighborhood_overview: Tanunda where our property is located is a lovely community, one of the main towns in the Barossa Valley. We are located a short stroll to the main street of Tanunda, access to shopping, cafes, some wineries, restaurants and the local foodland open 7 days. The cottage is located in historic Goat Square.

description:
Barossa Idyll Studio is located in the centre of the Barossa in Tanunda a short walk to cafes, wine bars and restaurants. A small and cosy haven; the Studio is attached to Barossa Idyll. With beautiful lawns and gardens, this is set in amongst magnificent Barossa vineyard and hills views.

The space
Barossa Idyll Studio is small and cosy but beautifully appointed with a Queen bed and quality linen. There is a brand new bathroom with a double vanity and rain shower. Fully air conditioned and with apple TV for movies . Amenities for tea and plunger coffee, crockery , cutlery, toaster and fridge. Small table and chairs .
The studio is set in a lovely gardened area. Walking distance to beautiful café breakfasts!

name: Barossa Bed & Breakfast
description:
BAROSSA BED & BREAKFAST
Luxury self contained accommodation, beautifully renovated original 1880 Ironstone house, located in Tanunda the historical heart of the Barossa.

Barossa B&B comfortably accommodates up to 6 people, children welcome.

The space
BAROSSA BED & BREAKFAST
Luxury self contained accommodation, beautifully renovated original 1880 Ironstone house, located in Tanunda the historical heart of the Barossa.

Barossa B&B comfortably accommodates up to 6 people, children welcome.

* Private use of house, no other guests or hosts, however the rates are per couple per night and assumes use of master bedroom only.
* Use of additional beds will incur a further $80 fee.

Access -We have key-less entry locks on the front and back doors. Guests choose a 4 digit code so they can come and go as they please without the need to juggle keys. (simple instructions on each door).

We can be contacted

name: Historic Kapunda School of Mines Homestay
description:
This delightful 1860s two-story building is a centrepiece in copper mining history. It not only provides a depth of incredible history, but it is also a very comfortable place to rest your head when visiting Kapunda and the surrounding areas such as the Barossa and Clare Valleys.

The Kapunda school of mines residence has spacious rooms, lofty ceilings, character and charm combined with luxury and convenience. Two double bedrooms can sleep up to 4 people very comfortably.

name: The Stables
description:
The space
Situated in Rowland Flat on a three-acre property, the stone cottage was the original tack and feed rooms for Mr Rowland's stables. Separated by a courtyard the stables are now the home of the host.

The cottage is comprised of a truly delightful bedroom with an antique double bed with stunning garden views; comfortable lounge room with TV/DVD, CD/radio, books and games; light and open equipped kitchenette with bar fridge, microwave, large electric frying pan and breakfast bar overlooking gardens through french windows (provisions for continental breakfast); the bathroom has both separate shower and claw foot slipper bath, toilet and vanity. R/c air-conditioning/heating and ceiling fans throughout.

Access from the cottage to your own verandah with garden spilling over…serenity…the perfect spot for breakfast, coffee or bottle of local wine. Enjoy walks through our vineyard and paddocks and come across surprises such as our free-range chooks, wo
neighborhood_overview: There’s plenty to do, only minutes away: Tanunda Pines Golf course, the bike/walking path (from Angaston to Gawler) runs past the top of our property, hot air ballooning, helicopter scenic flights, wineries, restaurants, art galleries, cafes and day spa (at the Novotel). What more could you want?
host_about:
A Barossa girl, I started my nursing at Angaston Hospital, played netball for Sandy Creek and Lyndoch clubs, was a tour guide for Orlando and, the then, Kaiser Stuhl wineries and also a wine rep for Tolleys; so I do appreciate Barossa wines and just love this area.

After many years living both interstate and overseas the magic of the Barossa Valley always draws you back!

Gardening, animals, people, fine wine and food are a few of my passions.

name: The Lodge Angaston
description:
Welcome to Angaston, Crown of the world renown Barossa wine region. Experience one of SA's most unique & grand designed buildings framed by 100 yo Moreton Bay fig trees. The Lodge towers prominently above Murray St and oh so conveniently located within minutes to award winning local cafes, shops & restaurants.
The lodge is well situated to access walking - cycling paths while road/mountain bike riders will delight in the local routes.

The space
The State of South Australia has listed the privately owned property on the State Heritage listing together with the two centuries old Moreton Bay Fig Trees encapsulate and frame the front festarde.
From the moment you open the door you'll step back through time. You'll be amazed and impressed by the height of the ceilings and the generous private space. The delightful collection of complementary period furniture and collectables will excite dreamy wonderment while the plush rugs are a tactile delight.
We a
neighborhood_overview: Angaston, 'the Crown of the Barossa' is nestled in the Barossa Ranges. You will need to set aside a couple of days to walk and taste and experience all the Main Street and historic surrounds have to offer.  Welcome to country hospitality.
host_about:
Hi. Thank you reading some of my bio.
Sharing a love of travel and discovery awarded me the opportunity to call the township of Angaston my Barossa home, my life and my passion. 
I would love nothing more than to welcome you and share some of my favourite authentically Barossa things to do.
Whether it's exploring a winery or two. Purely for research purposes of course. Taking in the local markets, catching up with friends while sourcing some locally grown produce to accompany our world class wines.  Walking or jogging and taking in the serenity of the every changing seasonal countryside. And sometimes sharing that space with wild kangaroos is majestic. 
You may even find me in a quaint little winter sunny spot or curled up with a good read in front of the fire.
The yang side of my personality loves nothing more than changing up the pace a bit.  Pop on some bright lippy,  jump on a scoot'ntoot scooter while getting some Barossa wind on my face.
I enjoy attempting all manner of sports and outdoor activities. Learning some footy skills from the local teens or switching up to my summer pace, water skiing & wake boarding.
I love open air concerts, festivals, camping, gardening, building/construction/renovation. 
My latest interest is self sustainability and environmentally sustainable practices. 
My mantra carpe diem. 
I can't wait to greet you and share a little of my Barossa home.

FREE WIFI, 3 bedrooms, offering 2 king beds and 2 single beds, Kitchen with dishwasher, open plan dining area, laundry facilities, all short stroll to Tanunda main street. Lovely rear backyard, and front has nice roses. The home is made of press tin which is unique to Barossa.
We can also offer our wine touring services to show your our amazing Barossa region. Airport and restaurant transfers

name: Historic Angaston Masonic Lodge
description:
Hello & welcome to Angaston (Crown of the Barossa) & home to one of South Australia's most prized architectural listing. The 147yo lodge is located within walking distance to everything Angaston. Local cafes, restaurants, award winning produce, wineries, bikeways/walkways, historical points of interest & surrounded by beautiful scenery. Affordable luxury.

The space
Architectural brilliance at its best. The overwhelmingly large space with impossibly high ceilings offer overwhelming spaciousness while the half metre thick stone walls are a great natural insulator. Nature sometimes needs a little help. The air-conditioning will keep you cool in summer while the oversized combustion heater & individual space heaters will keep you warm in winter. Natural light streams through the well appointed windows and offers glimpses of the historic walk and surrounding trees outside. Naturally beautiful & well appointed collectable furniture complements all the modern amenities,
neighborhood_overview: Put simply, friendly country hospitality.  We look forward to meeting you and welcoming you to our township and world class Barossa region. You will love the culture, history and regional diversity. Our community is safe, walking the streets isn't a worry, please consider, not all roads are well lit. we can provide you with a torch or download a torch to your mobile phone.

name: The Cottage at Riverside Farm
description:
A beautiful, secluded, self contained cottage in the Barossa Valley overlooking the North Para River. There are many places to walk, picnic or simply enjoy the view. All modern amenities included and sleeps up to 4 people. A couple of minutes away from Chateau Yaldara, the Lyndoch Hill Restaurant and the Lyndoch main street. Only a few minutes more to Tanunda and the other wineries and restaurants in the Barossa Valley.

The space
Unique views and park like surrounds make this a truly relaxing getaway. With virtually no surrounding noise or light sources the days are peaceful and the night sky truly stunning.

Find us at www/riversidefarm/net/au or search for 'Riverside Farm Barossa Valley' on the web.

Guest access
All areas are accessible but please leave things as you find them

Other things to note
This is a working farm so please exercise common sense when moving around the property.

name: Barossa Millhouse
description:
The Barossa Millhouse is a charming older style stone cottage in a spacious garden setting. It welcomes with polished floorboards, natural light, original paintings by local artists and comfy slightly vintage furniture. Ducted air-con for temperature control, a claw foot bath to languish in & cosy quilts.

The space
It's a hospitable space to relax in or enjoy with friends

Guest access
They have the whole house and verandah, the garden and can help themselves to any produce in the garden

Other things to note
Although there are three bedroom that sleep Jl to 7 people, there is also a fold out sofa bed in the lounge room.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is full of wonderful old stone buildings , is great for walks, and peaceful. The main street has everything you need.  Kapunda is close to everything .
host_about:
Hi there, 
I'm an artist and business owner living  in the Barossa Valley. I love characterful houses, homes and hospitality and I have  three accommodations available in South Australia.
I have a weakness for beautiful stone homes typical to South Australia, that have a European feel. I appreciate natural light, wooden floorboards, enhancing architectural features and preserving what works from the past whilst adding charm and modern comforts. I like my guests to feel they have a stylish home away from home. 
My renovations style is comfy French provincial with a touch of vintage and original artworks on the walls for a restful and inspiring stay.
I travel a lot myself so I appreciate what it is to arrive to a place that feels like you can kick your shoes off, pour a wine and relax.

name: A Barn in the Barossa
description:
A Barn in the Barossa is a 2 storey picture book bluestone home architecturally renovated to celebrate wood, stone & natural light. It’s been featured by Qantas and other magazines. A one hour drive from Adelaide central and 12 minutes from famous Barossa Cellar doors. The ClareValley and Auburn are within range at 40 minute drive.

Guests love the unique experience of the barn with beautiful spaces to relax and unwind. They are always delighted. The peace and starry nights are superb.

The space
Welcome to the barn, a much loved spacious beautiful home with pitched ceilings and open plan living room which catches the morning sun in summer and the shade in winter.

Ground yourself and unwind in the Barossa.

The barn is a solid 1860s structure made from local blue stone, Mintaro slate, polished thick original wooden floors and beams converted with the help of an architect and a local builder to a very comfortable home and spaci
neighborhood_overview:
The barn is 18 minutes to Maggie Beers Farm shop and The Eatery ( a very delicious dining experience featuring local produce and shared plates style ) & 24 minutes to the Barossa Farmers Markets and all that ANGASTON and Vintners restaurant . Take in the sculpture park lookout with stunning views across the Barossa.

Explore the Kaiser Stuhl national park where you can see kangaroos if you keep your eyes peeled and tread softly.
Yalumba winery and many boutiques wines are great to visit in the area.

Tanunda is 30 minutes drive from the barn and has boutique shopping, more wineries, cafes restaurants and art galleries.

Local amenities, pubs, supermarket, park for the kids and landscaped duck pond, and country bakery.

The barn is a solid 1860s structure which has been converted with the help of an architect and a local builder to a very comfortable home and spacious living.

The barn is located on the edge of the charming

name: 'THE CHURCH' Guest Home Gawler/Barossa Region
description:
Welcome to our beautiful, self-contained 3 bedroom guest home, where the property is exclusively yours during your stay. You can experience staying in a former church, located in the Town of Gawler, on the doorstep of the wine & gourmet regions of the Barossa Valley & gateway to the Clare Valley & only a 1 hour drive from the Adelaide cbd.

The space
This former church is a fully self-contained 2-storey home, providing 3 bedrooms (1 downstairs & 2 upstairs), 2 bathrooms (1 on each level), 2 living & dining areas (1 on each level), with an outdoor entertaining pergola, barbecue space, lawned garden areas, a secure, double undercover carport, for your vehicles and cooling & heating.

Guest access
There is secure, undercover parking in the double carport for 2 vehicles.
There is space in the driveway for an additional 2 vehicles.
There is a local taxi & bus service, shuttle services & guided tour options.

Other things to
neighborhood_overview: 'THE CHURCH' is located only minutes from Gawler's main street line. It is on the doorstep of the Barossa Valley & at the gateway to the Clare Valley & less than an hour from the Adelaide cbd.
host_about:
Welcome to our unique home, which is a former local church circa 1867, located in the historic Town of Gawler, on the doorstep to our famous Barossa Valley and at the gateway to the equally renowned Clare Valley wine regions of South Australia.

We thoroughly enjoy travelling be it local, interstate or overseas. We live at 'THE CHURCH' ourselves in between guest bookings. In our own travels, we often stay in privately owned accommodation and we always respect others' homes and holiday places, as if the properties were our own.

Our guests have given us excellent feedback, both privately and online, in relation to their experience in staying at 'THE CHURCH', which we greatly appreciate.

We look forward to you enjoying our home during your stay in this beautiful region of South Australia! 

Kind Regards
KAREN V. & family - Guest Home Owners & Hosts of THE CHURCH Gawler/Barossa Region, South Australia.

description:
A lovely fully renovated 1950's house in the heart of Angaston. Experience the Barossa like a local. A short walk to the main street and less than 10 minutes drive to Tanunda. Drop into a winery, enjoy a balloon ride across the Barossa or just kick back enjoy the pace of life.

This is an original 1950's house located in the heart of Angaston.

Ample space in the living area to relax and a fully equipped kitchen if you wish to take advantage of the tasty local produce. There is a large garden with seating and a BBQ, so in the warmer months you can delight in the outdoors. In winter heating through the house keeps you toasty warm creating a lovely space to just hang out.

The house is exclusively yours and we leave some breakfast provisions, coff
neighborhood_overview: A beautiful town in the heart of the Barossa, Angaston is nestled in the rolling hills away from the hustle and bustle of the city. A great place to unwind and just enjoy the local places to dine or take a walk around the streets soaking up the feel of the Barossa.

description:
Situated in Bethany, our fully self-contained stone cottages are located in the heart of the Barossa Valley.
Bordered by vineyards and a stunning outlook to the Barossa Ranges, the area is steeped in history and boasts of great walks as well as being surrounded by award winning wineries and restaurants.

description:
The perfect getaway. A uniquely secluded, air conditioned, bed and breakfast cottage in a romantic setting, exclusively for two. Vistas over looking rolling hills and vineyards from the paved terrace. A country charmed garden, a self cook full breakfast and a two person therapeutic spa.

The space
Enjoy the peacefulness and exclusivity of the Barossa Valley countryside. Stunning paranoramic views of glorious green rolling hills and vineyards as far as the eye can see. Evening visits by the local birds kangaroos and koalas . The flora and fauna will keep you encapsulated to the region.

Guest access
You'll have full exclusive access to a fully equipped kitchen, BBQ, two person spa, TV with fetch TV and Netflix. Breakfast provision including eggs, bacon, continental breakfast and many teas and coffees along with samples of local chocolate and port.

neighborhood_overview:
Secluded country cottage. Shops and restaurants are within a comfortable driving distance. This is a great location to launch your self drive tour of the Barossa.
If you are traveling here for the first time or would like some new ideas - We are more than happy to help with additional information and suggestions on restaurants, wineries, places of interest, walking trails and more.
host_about: We enjoy travel and enjoy knowing what you love about travel too. We love getting to see something more of each local region. We have unlimited understanding and knowledge of our local region to help make your stay a little bit better. By meeting locals and travellers we enjoy sharing stories, finding and creating something special together.

name: Wroxton Grange
description:
Our place is close to restaurants and dining. You’ll love our place because of the outdoors space and the light. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and families (with kids).

The space
We are a married couple who live in a spacious bluestone homestead, circa 1870, & enjoy sharing our family heritage with others. You are welcome to walk our beautiful 500 acre property with its birdlife, drystone walls, vineyards, sheep & cattle.

Guest access
The spacious guest suite is private & self contained with all amenities & has its own private entrance from the front verandah which is ideal for outdoor breakfasts.
neighborhood_overview: We are situated close to a conservation park with its Aussie wildlife or take a short 5km drive to the nearest town of Angaston, which has an English heritage & is known as the foodie capital of the Barossa.  It has a Saturday morning Farmers Market, cheese shop, coffee shops, wine tasting room, parks & a pleasant village atmosphere.
host_about: My husband, Ian & I are third generation vignerons on our family vineyard property in the Eden Valley region of the beautiful Barossa, renowned for its fine food & wine.  Ian is the vigneron & I work at the library as local history officer.  We have travelled widely, to North & South America, Europe, Africa, Asia & New Zealand and a favourite destination is England.  We now enjoy driving with our caravan to all parts of this wide brown land of Australia.  We have hosted B&B guests in a self contained queen suite in our spacious Victorian homestead  for many years & have always enjoyed sharing our corner of the world with others.  We would now like to welcome you to this special place with its peace amid immense rural beauty, yet close to all the attractions of the Barossa, such as the nearby Conservation Park, Saturday Farmers Market, wineries, restaurants & more!

name: Lambert Estate Retreat
description:
You’ll love the house because of Just 3 minutes’ drive from the heart of the Barossa Valley wine region (Angaston). It is 9 minutes’ drive from the Barossa Farmers Market and 20 minutes’ drive from The Barossa Valley Golf Club
Located in the Lambert Estate Winery, the house looks down the beautiful vineyard. Enjoy your day relaxing in the yard and having the kangaroos as your traveling companions
The entire house is good for couples, business travellers, families (with kids), and big groups
host_about: The Barossa Valley is renowned wine-producing region northeast of Adelaide. If you are a wine lover, this is the destination you must visit. We try our best to offer you the home-feeling accommodation.

name: Lemke Cottage,Moculta, Barossa Valley
description:
Our place is ideal for couples and business travellers. It has been our home away from home for 26 years. We have furnished it with locally made antique furniture. Jan has the largest collection of wire ware in Australia and guests will see these items displayed in the kitchen and throughout the cottage. The cottage is fully equipped with TV and free Wi Fi.
Guests are provided with a light breakfast with a selection of cereals, bread for toast, a selection of condiments and tea or coffee.

The space
Lemke Cottage is located in the small hamlet of Moculta, 8kms from Angaston. The cottage has two bedrooms, one in the loft and the second on the ground floor. The cottage was built in the 1860's and at various times it was a school, store and for a time licensed to sell alcohol. Daniel Lemke, after whom the cottage is named, moved into the cottage initially teaching the local children but later turned his hand to organ building. He built a number of small or
neighborhood_overview: Moculta is a quiet little hamlet of about 280 residents. It is served by two Lutheran churches, Gruenberg and Gnadenberg.  Both are historic and worth visiting.  A visit to the Barossa wouldn't be complete without a visit to the Barossa Valley Cheese Company to purchase some locally made cheese and crackers to go with your favourite wine.There are a number of wineries a short drive away, with Henschke Hill of Grace Winery and vineyard the closest. There is an information book with our selection of favourite  take away and restaurants for the information of guests.
host_about: John and Jan Shepherd have owned Lemke Cottage for 26 years.  Both have lead professional lives and have used the cottage as a weekend escape during this time. They have travelled extensively and stayed in B and B's rather than hotels and motels.  They decided to share their unique cottage with others and offer it as an Air BnB. They both enjoy overseas travel but also have travelled extensively throughout Australia.  John now runs a consultancy helping businesses grow, and Jan keeps busy with volunteering as a Justice of the Peace, Folk Dancing and Tai Chi.  They both enjoy music and regularly attend Adelaide Symphony Orchestra Concerts. They have 9 grandchildren and enjoy time with their family.

description:
Luxury apartment on offer right in the heart of the Barossa Valley, Tanunda. 2 bedrooms 2 bathrooms, FREE WIFI, full kitchen with coffee machine, dishwasher, access to laundry, own spa bath, double shower, 1 King bed which can split to 2 singles and 1 queen. Access to swimming pool. Let us tour you as well. Great location to walk to restaurants, cafes and some wineries.

We are also Tour Barossa so would love to help with all your wine touring needs, airport transfers and restaurant.

Guest access
Complimentary Wi-Fi and access to swimming pool, walk to shops, cafes and wineries and brewery, also access to our facilities of arranging our award winning tours to complete the package. We can also arrange onsite relaxation massages. We also have a strict No Party Policy no access to the swimming pool area after 9pm and not to be used by people who are not paying guests to Barossa Dreams and Barossa Valley Apartments.

description:
The West Wing 1 Bedroom Suite is a totally separate wing of our house, separated by a locked door. We live at the other end of the house next to the pool. Private ensuite bathroom,aircon,electric blanket, robes, fridge, micro,expresso coffee machine.Your own private lounge has 42" TV. Free Netflix.Free Wifi. Shared access to our pool. A 2nd Queen bedroom is available.The Queen room cannot be booked by itself as it shares the bathroom/toilet in the King.

The space
Luxury modern apartment style accommodation.The West Wing is a totally private wing of our house,separated by a locked door. We live at the other end of the house next to the pool .Your have your own private entrance,off street parking and shared access to our beautiful in ground pool. Free WiFi.

description:
My place is walking distance to Wineries, Brewery, restaurants and cafes, shops. Barossa Dreams offers up to 6 bedrooms, 4 bathrooms, 2 kitchens, Complimentary Wi-Fi and access to swimming pool on site shared with Barossa Valley Apartment guests. Flexibility with bedding configurations. We are also Tour Barossa so can help with touring needs. Base price quoted is on up to 10 people house can accommodate up to 17 people with 4 people utilising 2 sofa beds. Additional charges apply numbers over 10

The space
Barossa Dreams offers great flexibility for groups, many of the bedding can be split into single beds as well. The standard bedding is 5 queen beds, 3 single beds and 2 double sofa bed. (4 of the queen beds can also be split into single beds at an additional charge).
The whole house, offers 2 kitchen facilities, dining area, sitting area, and the 6 bedrooms and 4 bathrooms.
Excellent location to walk down the road to wine bars, restaurants, cafes, sho

name: Casa Rossa - modern Barossa home with vineyard
description:
A hidden paradise in the heart of the Barossa, with everything you need for a peaceful family-friendly getaway. It is the perfect home base for exploring the Barossa Valley and making the most of your stay, whether you're an outdoors type, a wine connoisseur or just simply here to unwind. Then spend your evenings looking out onto its private vineyard and drinking in the sights and smells of nature at your doorstep, or cozy up by the log fire with a glass of wine

The space
Picture a rustic-style farmhouse, complete with solid red bricks, wide windows and wooden fixtures throughout - but with a newly refurbished contemporary bathroom and full air-conditioning for a touch of modern luxury.

Upon arrival you may enter through the laundry, or take the scenic route via the garden, vineyard and terrace courtyard to enter into the kitchen area, which is equipped with a dishwasher and brand-new induction stovetop, and soaks up the sun all day long through its Fr
neighborhood_overview:
Casa Rossa is located in Lyndoch, South Australia, Australia.

Lyndoch is a small but thriving town in the heart of the Barossa Valley, and is growing and improving constantly. From the property, it is about a twenty minute scenic walk into town, or a speedy five minute drive.

You should be able to stock up on most things in Lyndoch, especially if you are in need of a quick fix. There is an IGA and convenience store, hairdresser and beautician, pub, and a number of great restaurants and cafes. Make sure you get to the Lord Lyndoch bistro for dinner!

For bigger shops, head to Gawler, about a ten minute drive from the property, which has a shopping mall and main street strip with Coles, Foodland, Big W, Target etc, as well as a number of boutiques and specialty stores.

Local attractions and venues include cellar doors and art Galleries.
Hot air-ballooning
Helicopter Scenic flights
Lord Lyndoch Restaurant
Lavender farm

name: The Art Box home gallery stay
description:
The Art Box is a unique home and gallery. It is close to the town centre, including wine & cheese tasting, restaurants, supermarket and parks.. You’ll love it here because of the fabulous views, your private spaces, walking distance to services and a gallery of my eclectic range of art .. The Art Box is great for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers. Check Airbnb experiences to see what creatives I might have available.

The space
The Art box offers you a private bedroom, private lounge, own bathroom and toilet, outdoor area and private access. Our house is open plan and has levels. Your space is on the higher level and each room has a door. Robes are provided for you as you move from your living space to your bathroom. The only steps (5) on this level are to your bathroom.
There is ducted air conditioning for the warmer months , the house is fueled by a wood fire which is in our living area but can warm your quarters also. Additional hea
neighborhood_overview: We are situated in a residential area where hills and trees are the backdrop. a beautiful spot. As we are situated toward the rear of the block it is very quiet and private.
host_about:
I am a contemporary artist and my home is my studio and gallery. I share the space with Stefan and our fur kids; Merri, Cub, Merlin and Phineas.
The environment is my inspiration and gives me peace and joy.
If you choose to stay with us you will gain access to my gallery and perhaps a sneaky art class.

name: Old Mill Cottage
description:
Old Mill Cottage is ideal for a quiet getaway with its picturesque garden to relax in. It is close to Dutton Park Recreation area including the Golf Course and Trotting Track. Walking distance to the main street with great eateries and up to date information centre. The Historic Mine site and the Mawson, Heysen and Kidman walking trails are on the doorstep. Kapunda is nestled between the famous Barossa and Clare wine regions.

The space
Old Mill Cottage provides premium self contained designer decor accommodation. Set in beautiful cottage gardens with its unique private courtyard which includes a stylish outdoor clawfoot bath for you to relax in and unwind.

Guest access
Main Street and Eateries are in walking distance of Old Mill Cottage, however parking is available on the main street. At the rear of the property is Davidson Reserve with the majestic gum trees and duck pond with walking trail.

name: Go Go's, Eden Valley the Garden of Grapes and Gums
description:
Nestled into a tranquil acre block in the main street of Eden Valley township, Go Go's enjoys the peaceful serenity of country South Australia but with easy access to highlights of the Barossa and Adelaide Hills.
With 2 large bedrooms including a cot for the littlies, Go Go's is perfect for couples, families, and wandering nomads who need to park up and power up. A fully equipped self catering kitchen and BBQ allow you the option of creating your own gourmet delights from your local purchases.

The space
In 2016 the Meadley family set up Go Go’s as a comfortable place for family and friends to enjoy when visiting from interstate and overseas.
“Go Go” is the Swahili name for Grandma, and became Grandma Meadley’s nickname during her and Grandpa Meadley’s travels over seas. This seemed the perfect name for their home away from home when visiting family in Eden Valley.
The Barossa and Adelaide Hills are renowned for their quality wines, and Eden Valley
neighborhood_overview:
The Barossa and Adelaide Hills are renowned for their wines. Many people visit the region for the quality and varietals of wine they have to offer to suit every pallet. The cooler climate of the Eden Valley creates zesty Rieslings, the Barossa Valley offers bold Shiraz, and the Adelaide Hill's crisp clean whites are only a short drive away too.
Local wineries include Henschke and Yalumba, plus numerous boutique cellar doors such as Fernfield Wines just 3km away and Edenmae 10km away in Springton.
South Australia and the Barossa Region are proud of more than just their quality grapes, but other gourmet foods galore. There are lots of opportunities to "Eat Local" in the main towns, or purchase delicious produce from the Mount Pleasant or Angaston Farmers Markets if visiting on a Saturday morning, which you can relax and enjoy at home in the comfort of Go Go's. Alternatively wander 100m down the street to the friendly Eden Valley Hotel where they can provide a quality value f

name: Barossa Valley Farm Cottage - Buckbury End Farm
description:
BUCKBURY END FARM - Est. 1895
Peace and quiet in a private freshly renovated stone cottage, Come and enjoy the pure serenity it has to offer.

Buckbury End Farm is located on the fringe of the Barossa Valley and is minutes to some fabulous wineries. It is a perfect base for your wine adventure.

The North Para river meanders it's way through and creates a spectacular backdrop continually changing with each season.

Other local attractions include the Whispering Wall, Lavender Farm &Jacobs Creek.

The space
Perfect for a staycation or as a work-from-home alternative.

We are taking extra care to disinfect frequently touched surfaces between reservations.

FARM COTTAGE - Private, freshly renovated stone cottage set on a 100 acre farm.

The farm cottage consists of stone walls, freshly renovated inside with a nice touch of modern yet trying to retain the old country feel.

Enjoy the peace
neighborhood_overview: Enjoy the pure peace and quiet that Buckbury End Farm has to offer. I have one friendly neighbour over the road only.

name: The Old Manse Shed, Barossa Valley
description: The Old Manse Shed is adjacent to main home here in Light Pass. Freshly painted, there is a comfy Queen bed, reverse cycle air con, heated blanket for wintry evenings. Self contained bathroom. TV, fridge, Nespresso maker, homemade Granola, milk, toaster + fresh sourdough, freshly home baked goods, bottle of wine upon arrival.  Table and chairs, room opens into garden. Church and vineyards at rear of property. Angaston, Tanunda and Nuri are all within 10 minute drive, 70 Cellar Doors in Barossa.
host_about: I am an English girl living the dream here in the stunning Barossa Valley.  I am married with two children, two soppy Labradors and a cat. I am crazy about baking, cooking, wine, family and friends. We live in what is the former Rectory / Manse in this tiny Hamlet of Light Pass, just a few minutes drive from all the gems of the Barossa, namely Angaston, Tanunda and Nuriootpa.  We look forward to welcoming you into our much loved home and hearing your stories.  I am fortunate to work in Australia's oldest family owned winery and so meeting people is literally part of my job and just love it.

name: Seppeltsfield Vineyard Cottage. Luxury & Privacy.
description:
Set amongst vineyards and tranquil gardens, exclusive luxury for one couple, perfect for unwinding or celebrating any special occasion.
Luxury facilities & amenities, plentiful provisions, peace, quiet, fresh air and privacy - relax and indulge!
Great location, walking distance to Hentley Farm, and Fino, Seppeltsfield. Close to Appellation, Barossa Valley Estate and Izway Wines, so much to see and do. We love sharing our local knowledge and helping with recommendations during your stay!

The space
Perfect for celebrating any special occasion or just for a holiday, the cottage is a wonderful place to relax as well as the perfect base for exploring the Barossa. Many guests comment it is a welcome "home away from home" if they are travelling for an extended period.

The cottage is self-contained and the tariff includes cooked and continental breakfast provisions, a bottle of local wine, gourmet platter produce, Nespresso coffee, teas and other
neighborhood_overview:
We are uniquely positioned with the amazing neighbours we have. The Barossa is known for its food, wine, music, heritage and hospitality and along Seppeltsfield Road we offer this in spades!! Apart from our visually beautiful location with vineyards and rolling hills, we are right next door to Hentley Farm (you can walk there on our private path)
Surrounded by boutique cellars doors, three of the Barossa's best restaurants FINO, Appellation and Hentley Farm and it's also a short walk to the iconic winery Seppeltsfield Estate. Here they offer not only bespoke wine tours including tasting a 100 year old Tawny and other unique experiences, but also the Jam Factory studio with artisans in residence. These include a knifemaker, milliner, shoe maker and potter. You can even book to make your own knife (but plan and book well ahead!) You will also find Vasse Virgin who make luxe Olive oil body and food products & Octeine Coffee & Cafe.
Other wineries include Hentley Farm, Barossa V
host_about:
Meeting people and introducing them to all the amazing things the Barossa has to offer is what I love to do.  Having been in luxury accommodation previously in a boutique Barossa hotel I am now enjoying the more personal and intimate side of running these beautiful BnB's.  I love the ever changing culture of the Barossa, the friendly community feel and sharing with guests local knowledge and the best kept secrets of this wonderful region. This keeps life interesting and fulfilling!

With an interest in photography and home styling I get to indulge in this passion with styling the cottage and Retreat and taking photos for our website, social media and other projects.

Peter and Sharyn (original owners) spent two years back in 2001 restoring the 1850s early German settler's cottage from a ruin into premium Barossa accommodation and creating the beautiful vineyard and gardens you see today. They are very proud to have helped preserve some precious Barossa history. I love to share their story and the history of the cottage with our guests.

I enjoy anticipating, meeting and exceeding our guest's expectations! 

My philosophy of "it's the little things that count" will be evident when you stay with us.

name: Indulge and Relax Tanunda
description:
Comfortable, modern cottage within 5-10 minute walk of the centre of Tanunda. Perfect base for touring wineries, easy walk from FermentAsian Restaurant, 1918 bistro, as well as cafes, bakeries and supermarket of central Tanunda.

Full modern kitchen and bathroom, peaceful garden with several relaxing areas to sip a glass of wine, chat or read.

The space
Suitable for one or two couples or small family. Grassed areas (great for bocce and cartwheels!), bunk beds (cot and highchair available), pool table, dart board and two mountain bikes for guest use (please email us your heights to check with available sizes).

Washing machine and dryer, high speed NBN WiFi equipped office area and Netflix access through Apple TV included.

Gas BBQ and heated patio area for outdoor dining year round.

Guest access
Quality Riedel Glassware.

Coffee pod machine and coffee plunger both available in full kitchen includ
neighborhood_overview:
Most cellar doors in the Barossa Valley are open 7 days for free wine tastings, mostly 10am or 11am until 4pm or 5pm (no booking required).

Eating at local restaurants, especially FermentAsian and 1918 (both walking distance from the house) may require a booking in advance and are thoroughly recommended

Tanunda Foodland Supermarket 5-10 minute walk or easy drive away.

name: The Stables at 1860 Wine Country Cottages
description:
This old stone building has been in use since the 1860s, including as crop storage, machinery shed and stables.
Now it’s been reimagined into a secluded hideaway for two with the perfect ingredients for pure luxury. There’s more of everything in The Stables – set on its own 500m2 block away from the other cottages, it includes a large living space, a spacious entertaining deck, private garden, high ceilings, cathedral skylights, extra large spa bath and log fire to cuddle up next to.

The space
Recharge your senses and enjoy a restful escape in the heart of boutique wine country at 1860 Wine Country Cottages, only an hour’s drive from Adelaide.
Here you’ll find all the ingredients for a relaxing break away from the everyday:
•Explore new tastes. Work your way through our three unique Boutique Wine and Food Trails, designed to give you a taste of the very best Eden Valley and the Adelaide Hills has to offer.
•Take a stroll on the wild side.

Luxury 2 storey home in the heart of the Barossa Valley with pool table and antique baby grand piano.

3 bedrooms have queen beds and the 4th with a double with bunk and an extra bed, suitable for a fourth couple or children.

A small park borders the home on 2 sides with room to play cricket, football or soccer!

Prepare your own meals in the fully equipped kitchen or take short stroll to the Weintal for breakfast, lunch or dinner, or dine out at anyone of the famous Barossa restaurants.

The space
Guests have use of the whole home regardless of whether it is 1, @ or 10 guests in your party.

Guest access
Access to garage is available on request

name: The Writer's Studio, Barossa
description:
Perfect for one or two people, The Writer's Studio is fully self-contained.
It has a really comfortable and firm inflatable queen bed.
Away from the main house, it opens out onto a small orchard.
This is a quiet oasis you can enjoy in between exploring all the Barossa has to offer.
It has dining and sitting areas as well as a reading nook in the loft. It has a sofa which can open out for a child if necessary. Or we can set up another inflatable bed in the loft, accessed by a loft ladder.

The space
The Writer's Studio is great for singles or couples.
I originally called it, The Shed, as it was once a hay shed with three walls and a grass floor. It morphed into The Writer's Studio after various friends asked to use it as their retreat to spend time quietly catching up on writing projects.
Wineries abound, as do eating opportunities, ranging from the award winning Appellation at The Louise and fermentAsian (consistently names in t
neighborhood_overview: There is a vineyard and winery cellar door directly opposite the house.  It is a short, two block walk to the main street, supermarket, bakery, coffee shops, restaurants, Information Centre and bicycle hire.
host_about:
I am a full time business coach helping business owners create businesses that work for not because of them.  My clients are mainly in Australia, New Zealand and the US, and as long as time zones are compatible I can work with them from anywhere. Thanks to (Hidden by Airbnb) I have conducted my client meetings from Jaipur (India), New York, Perth, Sydney, South Australia and San Diego.
Clearly - one of the  things I can't live without is travel.
And I can't live without my Kindle - which has lightened my travel load enormously. No more books to carry and leave as I pick up more.
I love great food and wine - I live in a wine region where the two go together.
I am a great guest. Quiet, fun, a reader and a walker.
My life motto is Stride Into Life.

name: Martinsell Cottage Barossa Valley
description:
A self contained private 3 bedroom cottage, set amongst 77 acres of ancient old red gums, nearby vineyards and historic barn / stables.

The cottage is set on the estate 500m from one of SA's most significant Georgian manors, 'Martinsell', built in 1901.
This is also available for accomodation of up to four guests please log in to Martinsell Manor for further details.https://airbnb.com/rooms/22636387

The space
There is a lovely large lounge with cosy wood heater and split system reverse cycle air conditioner and a fully equipped kitchen. The cottage is in a very peaceful country location with the closest neighbour being a kilometre away. Shower or bath in our soft rainwater provided to the cottage, whilst the outside taps are supplied with spring water.
No wi fi available

Horses are welcome with secure yards and plenty of parking for horse floats. Daily permits are available nearby for horse riding in the neighbouring forests
neighborhood_overview:
The Pewsey Vale area was settled by English, Scottish and German settlers. Pewsey Vale is a part of the world-famous Barossa Valley food and wine region, famous for bold red wines, delicate Pewsey Vale Rieslings, and the finest boutique foods.

The Barossa and its surroundings offer a wide variety of activities from hot air ballooning to trekking, cycling, horse riding, fishing, kayaking, wine tasting and more.

Closest large stores:
Gawler (25min drive / 20km nth west) has a many large town facilities and services including;
•Supermarket open until 9pm mon-sat
•24 hr petrol station

The local town of Williamstown (10min drive / 10km west) has a small general store, cemist, hotel, and bakery etc.
We are close to the National Motor Museum in Birdwood 18km, the famous Collingrove hillclimb circuit, and some of the best driving roads in Australia, through the Adelaide Hills and Barossa Ranges.

A Barossa Valley information guide
host_about: We are a  retired couple who really enjoy living in the countryside, renovating historical buildings, gardening and hobby farming. Having hosted bed and breakfasts for many years, we enjoy meeting guests from all over the world and providing information on the Barossa area and beyond.
neighbourhood: Pewsey Vale, Barrossa Valley , South Australia, Australia

name: Historic home on 65 acres in top Barossa location
description:
Premium self-contained accommodation in a fantastic central location. Hanisch Haus is a recently renovated home built in 1907. Guests have full access to the entire home, owned and operated by renowned Barossa winemaker, Rolf Binder.
An ideal retreat option for those wanting to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery and tranquility of the property, with superb access to local wineries, restaurants and shopping. Full breakfast provisions are included with a bottle of wine, made by Rolf.

The space
What's special about our place?

Loads of character - this is a great option for those who want to stay in a place that feels very much 'at home'. Items have been thoughtfully chosen to add interest & charm to the property, with plenty of extras that you certainly wouldn't find in a hotel room.

The location is fantastic - nestled on the very edge of Tanunda township, guests enjoy a rural feeling while still having the advantage of being centrally
neighborhood_overview: What's not to love about being in the Barossa?! Beautiful scenery, amazing local food & wine, wonderfully friendly people. It's our little slice of paradise!
host_about:
We love food, wine and travel and really enjoy meeting guests from all over the world that stay on our property. It's also fun to be able to see guests at our cellar door nearby, where we offer wine tastings and tours of the winery.
Rolf Binder winery was established in 1955 and we produce a wide range of white, red and fortified wines, selling into 18 countries around the globe. Our guests can enjoy a special bottle of wine, made by Rolf! Full breakfast provisions highlighting local Barossa produce are also included.
We stay on top of communication with guests to ensure they have an enjoyable stay and also provide lots of useful local knowledge to help plan time in the region.  Our goal is to make guests feel like they have a sense for what it's like to actually live in the Barossa. Stay with us for a unique visit to our beautiful region! 
Cheers, Cynthia & Rolf

Heritage home at the edge of the Barossa Valley (wine region) in the township of Mt.Pleasant with rural land behind which has sheep,cattle and an Alpaca in our paddock. We have an oval close, walking distance to chemist, local pubs, bakeries, butchers and coffee shop. We have the best farmers market every Saturday Morning at the oval complex. Some of our land adjoining Mount Pleasant oval complex can be available for people with horses involved in equestrian events.

name: Boongarrie Luxury Tent - privacy, luxury, nature
description:
Boongarrie Luxury Tent offers privacy and luxury on a beautiful parcel of land in the Barossa Valley. Wake to views of majestic red gums and in the cooler months enjoy a campfire and savour the Barossa Red left for your enjoyment. Little touches of luxury and generous breakfast supplies make this the perfect place for couples to explore the valley. Why not treat yourself and try something different.

The space
The tent has a luxurious interior with a gorgeous ensuite bathroom.
A large queen size bed, kitchenette, with fridge, microwave, toaster, kettle and plunger coffee facilities, and for your comfort there is a reverse cycle air conditioner, TV and blue tooth speaker.
The bathroom has a rain shower and a claw foot bath, toilet and vanity. Ironing facilities and a hairdryer provided.
Outside there is an outdoor kitchen with a BBQ and a side burner, sink, all utensils and pans cooking facilities and a red gum bar and stools.

Gu
neighborhood_overview: Flaxman Valley is a quiet regional area with some small wineries and farms.
host_about:
My partner Garrry and I have lived in the beautiful Barossa for over 20 years. We enjoy all the fine foods and wines that are at our doorstep and love meeting new people. We enjoy travelling both overseas and in Australia, and love getting away from it all under the stars and living it up in luxury.
We love fishing and retreating when possible, to one of our beach houses on the Yorke Peninsula. 
We understand from our own travelling that guests may want total privacy and independence or wish to have some assistance and interaction.

Boasting 4 spacious and stunning queen size bedrooms, accommodating up to 11.

Two bathrooms, spa bath, bathrobes, comfy couches, a log fire, free Netflix & WiFi

host_about: Hi, I am happily married to my sweetheart who I met when I was 12. Married at 19, have 4 lovely kids who married 4 lovely partners and we now have 14 adorable grandies!!  We have run a florist shop for 15 years whilst renovating two properties for Bed and Breakfast in the Barossa Valley. Now we have retired from floristry and we are enjoying the beautiful serenity of the Barossa Valley more and more. We love to travel and have been fortunate to visit many countries overseas, which helps when it comes to seeing what our guests in our accommodation need for comfort and an unique experience. Book with us and we will share some fabulous intimate wineries.
