name: Vineyard Views
description:
Vineyard Views, hidden in the ridges of Menglers Hill near Angaston, on a working-vineyard, delivers everything you need for your next weekend getaway in the Barossa.
With Angaston a five-minute drive in one direction and world class wineries a five-minute drive in another, Vineyard Views has you covered. You can stay in and watch the sunset from the deck with a glass of shiraz, or you can use the peaceful location as a base to visit nearby cellar doors and other Barossa attractions.

The space
The newly renovated suite was once a part of the original homestead. It now features a large bedroom, a modern bathroom and kitchen with (cook top, toaster, coffee machine) perfect for a solo or couple getaway. The suite sits just in front of the family home but has its own access and entrance, giving you privacy during your stay and uninterrupted views of the valley.
So... don’t just take our word for it, that the sunset view from the deck is one of the most sp

The blue room at Pembury Mews built in 1905 is situated on 10 acres. Your room has a comfortable queen bed, is charming & spacious with tall ceilings only 5 minutes walk into historic Angaston in the Barossa Valley.
Nesstles in a valley close to the town only 5 minutes walk to supermarkets restaurants and cafes

The space
Single bedroom apartment with its own access

Guest access
Access is separate to the main homestead and via a lock box with a key

description: Stoneleigh Cottage B&B is a heritage listed property located in the historic town of Angaston, in the beautiful Barossa Valley. The cottage is divided into two self-contained units, featuring a bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, lounge and laundry. Each Unit as a private entrance and carport. Stoneleigh Cottage is ideal for couples travelling together who would like to have their own private accommodation. The cottage is within walking distance to shops, restaurants, bakeries and a grocery store.

name: Under the Vines....a Vineyard Escape!
description:
Under the Vines is a self contained cottage in five acres of vineyard and native bushland, in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley.

Peaceful and private, this beautiful accommodation is perfect for couples, small groups and families, and is a lovely base to explore the Barossa region.

Every window has a vineyard view!

The space
The spacious living area - with comfy sofas, beanbag, cushions and snuggly blanket - is set up with complimentary Wi-Fi and Netflix, a large smart TV, PlayStation & Blu-ray DVD.

The main bathroom has a huge double shower and luxurious two-person spa, and a generous selection of towels, earth friendly body and spa products, and flatscreen TV/DVD (viewed from the spa).
Bathroom 2 features a coloured rainshower.

The kitchen has full facilities - oven, cooktop, microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher and coffee machine, and and a great range of regional provisions included for breakfast/brunch
neighborhood_overview:
Easy driving distance to world class wineries and food destinations, quirky cafes, parks, walking and bike trails. Come and explore for yourself!

The Barossa Valley offers many unique and rich experiences - food, wine, culture, heritage. Allow time to immerse yourself in some of these....and then come back again for another bite!

name: 10 Murray  Tanunda  feel like a local
description:
10 Murray St Tanunda is situated in the main street of Tanunda, in the centre of the Barossa Valley. A few doors from the main street enjoy a short and relaxing walk to shops, cafes & award winning restaurants.
10 Murray is a blue stone fronted cottage, built in 1890. The interior has been totally renovated and modernised. With 3 large bedrooms all with king beds. Perfect for a group as the beds split to singles if needed. Stay and feel like a local in our beautiful home you wont want to leave

The space
Wonderful diversity of this property with main setup of bedding being 3 kings, all beds can be changed to offer single bedding. Perfect for a group of friends, family or corporate visitors.
Under floor heating in winter and reverse air conditioning throughout the house makes your stay super comfortable.
We do not supply breakfast provisions as we love the variety of cafes in town and encourage you to explore locally. We do provide a few cooking basi

name: Casa Mia Angaston
description:
Right in the heart of Angaston, this historic building has been transformed into a stunning 2 bedroom cottage with renovated kitchen and bathroom. Two bedrooms with very comfortable queen size beds, a cosy living room, as well as kitchen/dining areas. You can enjoy a relaxing breakfast in the beautiful, italian inspired courtyard. The cottage is in walking distance to great restaurants, cafes, wineries, bike track, playgrounds and the farmers market.

This stunning historic cottage is situated on the main street and has access to all the experience and amenities of Angaston. Complimenting this is fabulous privacy to enjoy your stay.

The 2 bedrooms have queen beds and quality and comfortable linen.

Spacious living room has 2 separate areas to relax.

The kitchen has a separate dining area as well as oven, stove, fridge, toaster, kettle and coffee machine. Cooking utensils and crockery provided also.

name: Historic Valley House in the Barossa Valley
description:
Min stay 2 nights, Check in 2pm - 8pm Check out 10am. Our guest suite has your own private entrance and is in the middle of Lyndoch, our lovely little country town. We are in the Barossa Valley and minutes away from world famous wineries and plenty of attractions. Valley House is a great base to explore the Barossa Valley, Adelaide Hills and Adelaide. Our guest suite is spacious and a short walk to the local cafe, restaurant, bakery, general store, hotel, pharmacy and several wineries.

The space
The guest suite has a spacious lounge/ dining room, bedroom and en suite bathroom. Our fireplaces are NOT operational. Your comfort is assured as we have reverse cycle ducted air conditioning and a ceiling fan in your bedroom. We provide coffee and tea making facilities, a microwave and small fridge. You are welcome to play our antique piano. Please be gentle as it is a family heirloom.

Guest access
You have the entire dining, lounge, bedroom and
neighborhood_overview: We are blessed with an award winning cafe, a delightful bakery, a delicious restaurant, a great country pub, a nice park, a peaceful recreation ground (including tennis courts) and many fantastic wineries within a stone's throw. We also have a walking trail and bicycle trail that runs right through the Barossa Valley (Gawler to Angaston) which is within two minute's walk.
host_about: Along with my wife Lee, I have enjoyed staying at many Air BnB locations. We have a lovely historic home we are looking forward to sharing with others. We enjoy chatting with guests to share what we know of Valley House and the fantastic Barossa Valley.

description:
This cute little flat is in walking distance to five wineries , local pub, local shop and restaurant. Disabled friendly with assistance bars either side of the toilet and a very large shower with assistance bar. Would suit Singles, Couples or Couple with one or two small children. Enjoy what the barossa has to offer within a short walk away! Please note this is strictly a Non Smoking accomodation.

1 bedroom flat with queen bed with ensuite, fully functioning kitchen, lounge (also futon for child ) tv. Outdoor patio to enjoy a nice glass of Barossa’s famous Shiraz. There is no smoking allowed on the premises

Property is handicap friendly. Bathroom and shower is large with assisting rails around toilet and in shower.

name: Angas's Retreat - with Country views
description:
Our 1940's self-contained cottage is located just 5 minutes walk to the main street shops, cafes and playground.
Newly listed, this cottage has been freshly painted, includes new linen and bedding with some antique touches.
The backyard has a view of the hills and creek, and creates the perfect backdrop to unwind for a weekend away. The ideal combination of location and country setting.

The space
The Cottage has been newly furnished and includes some touches of antique furniture to compliment the cottage's heritage.

The open-plan living, dining and kitchen is a very spacious area, giving everyone enough room to relax. The kitchen island bench creates a social space and plenty of room for those who like to cook up a storm. The kitchen is fully equipped including a microwave, fridge and dishwasher. There is tea and coffee included with some fresh fruit on arrival, and a few other kitchen staples supplied.

There are three bedrooms in
neighborhood_overview:
There is so much to explore within walking distance; Barossa Valley Cheese company, several cafes and eateries, playgrounds and walking paths.
You will find information on my other Barossa favourites and towns on arrival, including wineries and walking trails.
The local Barossa Farmers Markets are held every Saturday morning, only 2 minutes drive away.
host_about:
I have lived in the Barossa for over 26 years. I love to call the Barossa home and enjoy sharing knowledge of what our beautiful region has to offer. I have worked in hospitality and the wine industry for 19 years, and customer service is a passion.
I love to explore other regions and have enjoyed several overseas holidays in the last 5 years, staying in several airbnb accommodation.

name: Deluxe Couples Spa Cabin
description:
Located on 8-acres in the heart of the Barossa Valley lies Seppelts View Cabins surrounded by South Australia’s most renown wineries and restaurants. Each cabin is self-contained with different cabin layouts to cater to couples and families.

The space
The Seppelts View Deluxe Spa Cabin is complete with a fireplace for those cold, cosy winter nights, a bathroom with spa and views of the nearby vineyards. You will also find a kitchenette with the essentials, and if you don’t feel like cooking, we’d suggest trying an array of amazing restaurants all within a 10 minute drive of your cabin!

Please note that unfortunately, this room cannot accommodate children.
host_about:
Located on 8-acres in the heart of the Barossa Valley lies Seppelts View Cabins surrounded by South Australia’s most renowned wineries and restaurants. Each cabin is self-contained with different cabin layouts to cater to couples and families.
There are several boutique wineries nearby, including Seppeltsfield Winery, which offers a cellar door and wine tours and is a 2 minutes’ walk from the accommodation. 

Other popular sites in the area include The Jam Factory, Maggie Beer’s Farm Shop and Hentley Farm. Other exciting destinations include the Barossa Farmers Market, and many more shops, cafes, restaurants, and wineries are just 10 minutes' drive away.

name: Cirillo Guest House
description:
In the heart of the Barossa, Cirillo Guest House is set in a tranquil and secluded location for the perfect getaway. The house is decorated in bright, clean furnishings. The house sits surrounded by some of the oldest vineyards in the world, planted in 1848 owned and operated by the Cirillo family.
The winery estate offers beautiful views of neighbouring vineyards and creates the perfect backdrop to unwind.

The space
Exclusively yours to enjoy, the provincial / Hamptons styled house offers three bedrooms along with modern open plan living spaces. The huge kitchen is fully equipped with an oven, microwave, fridge/freezer and dishwasher. There is a large island bench for communal dining.
The clean and bright bathroom has a rain shower with a separate second toilet located adjacent to the laundry. The laundry has a washing machine and clothes dryer.
There is a fireplace, plus panel heaters in each bedroom for the cooler months. Evaporation cooling th
neighborhood_overview: The property backs onto the Barossa Bike Trail. We are a stone’s throw from the Barossa Farmers Market and a short drive from Barossa’s most popular local restaurants and cellar doors.

name: Gateway to the Barossa
description:
Newly refurbished cottage on a private 15 acre farm located at the gateway to the Barossa Valley.

Located a 5-minute drive out of Gawler and only 5 minutes from the closest wineries, you're only a short drive to many of the Barossa favorites including Seppeltsfield, Penfolds, Rockfords, and many, many more!

Our self-contained cottage comes with everything you'll need for a trip out of Adelaide, including a brand new kitchen and bathroom.

The space
The cottage courtyard offers an intimate space to enjoy breakfast under the orange tree or an evening drink after a long day touring the wineries.

The cottage sleeps 2 people in the main bedroom and up to another 2 people on the fold-out couch.

You will be sharing the farm with chickens and a small group of sheep in the back paddock, making this an authentic farm stay.

The owners also come and go from the main house, however, the cottage is privately located for

name: 'Mattschoss House c1890' - Barossa comfort & style
description:
'Mattschoss House' offers a unique place in Barossa Valley's history established in '1890'. Refurbished to reflect it's heritage with clean modern furnishings, a comfortable retreat all year round. Set along the Para River with vineyard views, an array of native birds and the infamous Western Ridge sunsets. Centrally located with great access to some of Barossa's iconic wineries and restaurants, with neighboring wineries just a stones throw from your front door.

The space
Whole house to yourself! With modern comfortable furnishings for you to relax and enjoy your time away. Featuring 3 double bedrooms all with luxury Queen beds, reverse cycle air conditioning throughout, fire place in the dining room, large fully equip country style kitchen with modern appliances. The formal lounge room allows you to soak up the warm sunshine, sink into the large sofa or curl up and watch the large screen TV with a glass of wine. The bathroom hosts heated floors, with a half bath
neighborhood_overview:
Located on the iconic Seppeltsfield Road you are walking distance to neighboring wineries and a short drive to icons like Maggie Beer Farm Shop, Appellation Restaurant, Peter Lehmann Wines, David Franz Wines, and Seppelsfield Winery. The bustling main street of Tanunda is close hosting our Barossa's Tourism hub along with coffee shops, bakeries and retail shops.
On Saturdays you can head to our local Farmer's Market for breakie and meet, taste and explore our finest in produce, baked goods, gin, wine and so much more.
You wont be short of things to do in the Barossa, head to Barossa.com for all the latest. When considering your travel plan at least a few days, there is so much you wont have time to see it all!

name: It's Bonza! Accessibility+comfort, Barossa Valley
description:
Newly listed in Dec '21! Welcome to our 24-acre hobby farm! Relax in the charming rustic cottage under the majestic Moreton Bay Fig's shade, with picturesque views of the vineyard, bushland and gardens. The self-contained cottage, well equipped for your comfortable stay, is accessible to all: we welcome people of all abilities as our valued guests! Included: coffee/tea, breakfast provisions; try our olives & honey from our bees. Suitable for a couple or 2 friends. Caravan/boat parking available.

The space
We designed the cottage with accessibility, inclusivity, and comfort in mind. In the kitchen: a kettle & toaster, a microwave, an induction hob, a mini-oven, a mini-fridge, dishwasher, a washing machine, and some cooking provisions including fresh herbs. There is a generous open living area, a comfortable king bed (can be converted to 2 single beds on request), and a spacious bathroom complete with a modern waterless toilet. A wheelchair ramp, extra-wide doors,
neighborhood_overview: We are located in Southern Barossa - offering the best of both the Adelaide Hills and the world-famous Barossa Valley. So much to explore: the wineries, restaurants and cafés, bushwalking and birdwatching in nearby nature reserves, kayaking and fishing at the local water reservoirs, historic sites and cultural events, a swimming pool in Williamstown, farmers markets and so much more ... A pleasant walking trail is just at our northern border - a 20min walk to Williamstown's cafes and shops, in the shade of old gum trees, and you could meet the neighbour's 2 curious alpacas that keep the grass down along the walking path :-)  We have prepared a guidebook and will be happy to suggest some local attractions.

name: Wyndways
description:
The home is ideal for couples, a group of friends or a family, the house has one large living areas, two bedrooms, one bathrooms with large shower and bath tub and separate toilet.
Centrally located in a heart of town, within walking distance to Tanunda's restaurants, cafes and shops.

With undercover eating area, with garden outlook and separate dinning room which leads onto the lounge and kitchen area.

The space
The home is super clean and has just about everything you possibly need.

Other things to note
Please take the time to sit in the garden and enjoy a cup of coffee and watch the world go by.
neighborhood_overview: Family friendly, quiet street and walking distance to main street and town park.

Enjoy living a country life style.
Raising two children

name: Old Barossa Valley Inn & Bakery-Entire Main House!
description:
Historic Lyndoch, is 1 hour drive from Adelaide CBD. Great place to base yourself for a relaxing food, wine, romantic or family getaway. Extremely comfortable private house in this unique 1850’s colonial building constructed as the Barossa Inn & licensed until 1912. Price is for 1 guest. Additional guests are $20/person/night. All guests staying need to be fully Covid vaccinated per eligibility in SA. Experience all the Barossa has to offer with Tanunda, Nuriootpa & Angaston nearby.

The space
This is the main house of the Barossa Inn & Bakery BnB with a romantic king-sized 4 poster bed in the main bedroom. A 5 minute walk to the town centre, with shops, restaurant, hotel and supermarket etc.

The BnB is an entire house with lounge (original 'front bar' of the Inn), kitchen, meals/dining, family, 3 bedrooms, laundry and large backyard.

We provide free wifi as well as Netflix, Stan and Prime. There is also a good collection of DVDs for guests
neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is the 'Gateway' to the Barossa Valley/ The residence gives you local ambience and history whilst providing a touch of luxury (enjoy the wonderful king-sized four poster-bed!). You have the opportunity to explore this vibrant foor and wine region, with the main Barossa towns - Tanunda, Nuriootpa and Angaston, all an easy drive away. Wineries and boutique shopping abounds in the area around the BnB. The bicycle track from Angaston to Gawler and beyond, passes nearby. Our BnB is a great starting point for your cycling adventure.
host_about:
Local Barossa family. Heather & husband Gordon together, offer you this accommodation in one of the historic buildings from the 1850s, in Lyndoch. Lovingly preserved and decorated, we hope our guests will relax and enjoy their stay. We’d be pleased to show you the original bakers oven which served the town for around 60 years. We live nearby and can respond to any requests, or can leave you to enjoy the serenity and luxury of our little piece of paradise!
We enjoy travel ourselves and experiencing AirBnB’s all over the world. Our guests come from all states of Australia, but also from nearly every continent, so it is a great pleasure to host  our guests from all walks of life. 
Enjoy all the Barossa Valley has to offer by basing yourself in Lyndoch with us. We particularly welcome our fellow South Australian residents, to enjoy some local tastes and experiences which are easily accessible, thoroughly delectable and exciting or relaxing - the choice is yours!

name: Halletts Valley Hideaway
description:
Charmaine and Steve are the hosts at Halletts Valley Hideaway. The cottage is tucked away on the outskirts of Tanunda, in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley. The property was rebuilt from the ground up in 2017 and features high quality fittings, furnishings, appliances and lighting, while recycling the original timber beams and local stone. Enjoy a fabulous getaway experience in a unique, private, secluded, self-contained cottage.

The space
A rare opportunity to enjoy recently refurbished, high quality accommodation, while experiencing one of the most panoramic views of the Barossa range.

A luxurious blend of rustic and contemporary themes in a secluded location nestled amidst vineyards in the heart of the Barossa.

In the cooler months, enjoy the fabulous Nectre slow combustion heater (kindling and firewood provided).

A generous selection of locally sourced Barossa food, drinks and nibbles supplied with our compliments for
neighborhood_overview:
Barossa Wineries…

The Barossa has a winemaking tradition stretching back to 1842 and, having escaped the ravages of the phylloxera virus that decimated many European and Australian vineyards in the nineteenth century, is home to some of the world’s oldest vines still in production. Today, the region is home to more than 150 wineries and 80-plus cellar doors. Whilst producers range from large-scale global operations to small-batch artisans they all retain a distinctly local character and visitors can be assured a warm welcome. The local tourist board provides a comprehensive guide to the region’s wine here. Here’s a few of our favourites (in no particular order):

Artisans of Barossa: a group of eight family-owned winemakers who share a tasting room on Murray Street, Tanunda – Hobbs of Barossa Ranges, John Duval Wines, Sons of Eden, Schwarz Wine Co, Purple Hands Wines, Spinifex, Lienert Vineyards and Chaffey Bros Wine Co.

Izway: a ten-minute drive from

name: Seppeltsfield Vineyard Retreat - Barossa getaway
description:
Set in the vineyards and gardens of our Seize the Day wine estate, our three bedroom house offers relaxed, premium self contained accommodation for up to 6 people in modern country style
Explore, relax, unwind, share good food, wine & company. Walking distance to Hentley Farm, a stone’s throw from Seppeltsfield Winery & many local boutique cellar doors, restaurants, Gin Distillery and other attractions along iconic Seppeltsfield Road, the perfect base for you to enjoy your Barossa experience.

The space
Recently re-furbished with all new furniture. Plenty of room to move, there are three comfortable bedrooms with brand new beds & crisp fresh Sheridan linens. A large fully equipped kitchen with plenty of bench space, including dishwasher, microwave, pantry supplies, Nespresso Coffee machine, range of teas, large new fridge, plus breakfast supplies, local gourmet produce for a grazing platter and a bottle of local wine. The large dining space has plenty of roo
neighborhood_overview:
Located just off the iconic Seppeltsfield Road.. We are uniquely positioned with the amazing neighbours we have. The Barossa is known for its food, wine, music, heritage and hospitality and along Seppeltsfield Road we offer this in spades!! Apart from our visually beautiful location with vineyards and rolling hills, we are surrounded by boutique cellars doors, three of the Barossa's best restaurants and the iconic winery Seppeltsfield Estate. Here they offer not only bespoke wine tours including tasting a 100 year old Tawny and a heritage winery tour, but also house the acclaimed FINO restaurant, and the Jam Factory studio with artisans in residence. These include a knifemaker, milliner, shoe maker, jewellery makers and potters. You will also find Octeine Coffee Cafe, and Vasse Virgin who make luxe Olive oil body and food products.
Other wineries include Hentley Farm ( which is right next door to us), Izway Wines, Barossa Valley Estate, Two Hands, Greenock Creek Wines, Kalleske
host_about:
Meeting people and introducing them to all the amazing things the Barossa has to offer is what I love to do.  Having been in luxury accommodation previously in a boutique Barossa hotel I am now enjoying the more personal and intimate side of running these beautiful BnB's.  I love the ever changing culture of the Barossa, the friendly community feel and sharing with guests local knowledge and the best kept secrets of this wonderful region. This keeps life interesting and fulfilling!

With an interest in photography and home styling I get to indulge in this passion with styling the cottage and Retreat and taking photos for our website, social media and other projects.

Peter and Sharyn (original owners) spent two years back in 2001 restoring the 1850s early German settler's cottage from a ruin into premium Barossa accommodation and creating the beautiful vineyard and gardens you see today. They are very proud to have helped preserve some precious Barossa history. I love to share their story and the history of the cottage with our guests.

I enjoy anticipating, meeting and exceeding our guest's expectations! 

My philosophy of "it's the little things that count" will be evident when you stay with us.

name: Peaceful 2br cottage in the 🖤 of Angaston
description:
Plum Cottage is a 1940’s miner’s cottage, renovated to ensure all modern conveniences. Everything you need for a getaway to the Barossa.

The space
Enjoy heritage Barossa with all the comforts.

Bedrooms are carpeted, and each furnished with hanging space, a queen bed and extra large quilt.

New kitchen includes gas cooktop, cooking essentials and saucepans – although you also have breakfast, lunch and dinner options just a five minute walk from the front door.

Brand new bathroom with shower and bathtub.

Multiple living areas for hanging out, eating, curling up with a book, or enjoying the fresh air from the large covered porch.

Sip wine from the Riedel glassware, enjoy sunset views over the garden from the living room sofa, and make yourself at home.
neighborhood_overview:
The cottage is on a quiet local street, 5 minutes walk from the main street of Angaston and its shops, supermarket, cafes, bakeries, pubs, restaurants, Casa Carboni cooking school and the Barossa Valley Cheese Company.

Angaston is surrounded by vineyards, fields and gums. Excellent access to Barossa wineries, the Angaston to Nuriootpa cycle track, the undulating hills of Barossa’s high country, our fabulous Barossa Farmer’s market, and the multi award winning Vintners Bar & Grill.
host_about: Hi! I'm a 30-something who's recently moved back home to South Australia after time in Sydney and London. I enjoy rock climbing, swimming, reading, cycling, skiing, coffee, tea, food and wine.

name: LYNDOCH GRAND VILLA IN BAROSSA VILLAGE SLEEPS 14
description:
Lyndoch Grand is located at the gateway to the Barossa Valley and this c1855 heritage-listed property is perfectly suited for large groups. It is fully self-contained with 7 bedrooms, 5 living rooms and 3.5 bathrooms. You'll have exclusive use of the entire house, conveniently located in the heart of Lyndoch village and a short walk to restaurants, wineries, shops and galleries. With space, elegance and natural surrounds, it's the perfect base from which to explore the Barossa region

The space
We've recently purchased this beautiful property, which was originally built as The New Lord Lyndoch Hotel in 1855. Steeped in Barossa Valley heritage it's been used as a hotel, courthouse, council chambers, delicatessen and a coffee palace prior to being faithfully restored as a grand private residence in more recent times. It's ideal for large groups and sleeps 14 people across 7 bedrooms. There's plenty of space to relax in one of the lounge rooms, the magnificent entert
neighborhood_overview: Lyndoch is one of South Australia's oldest towns and is the gateway to the world famous Barossa Valley, just 56km north of Adelaide. It was the first Barossa town settled and the first vines were planted here. It still retains a quiet village feel, with the local hotel, supermarket, traditional butcher, bakery, library and post office a two minute walk away. Surrounded by vineyards and glorious red gums, Lyndoch is an ideal base for exploring all the Barossa has to offer.
host_about: I'm a self-employed musician and antique dealer. I'm outgoing, energetic and optimistic, with a keen sense of humour. I love my family, socialising with friends, hunting for interesting antique and vintage items and playing music. I enjoy cooking, especially Italian and Mexican food, and don't mind a nice cold beer.

name: Teresa Garden Holiday Home
description:
Teresa garden is a beautiful and historical cottage in the heart of the Barossa Valley. It only takes 2 minutes by car to reach Tanunda town.
You'll feel life has slowed down in this comfortable, peaceful, well equipped, quiet, sunny retreat.
Whilst reconnecting with nature, you can also discover Australia's most famous wine-producing region making this an ideal place to stay.
The cottage can accommodate at least 6 people, making it the perfect place for families or groups of friends.

The space
-About Teresa Garden-

A large house overlooking the vineyard.
4 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms which can accommodate 8 people.
Well-established gardens with a fountain to greet you at the turn around driveway.

-Living & dining area-

Large formal dining room seating for 8-10 people.
Formal lounge for quiet reading.
Informal lounge with large TV and 2nd dining room off the kitchen.


-Bedrooms
neighborhood_overview: Teresa Garden is adjacent to Tanunda township. It is only a two minute drive from the town centre, shops and restaurants.

name: Whiterocks - 2 night
description:
This beautifully presented white sandstone and red brick Bungalow was built in 1935 and is located within walking distance of the main street of Tanunda.

The grand entrance to this home is impressive and leads you through the glass door entrance and hallway which is of grand proportions (which is to be expected in a home of this era). As you enter the front hallway the ornate dome and chandeliers are stunning and gives you a glimpse of what is still to come....

With three large bedrooms that flow from the main hallway, two with ornate fireplaces and original features including the window box seat in the master king size bedroom. The new bathroom has underfloor heating plus an additional toilet.

The home has been painted in neutral tones which accentuates the dark wooden features surrounding the windows, skirting boards and woodwork throughout the house.

name: 1890 2 STOREY HAYLOFT - BAROSSA HILLS COTTAGES
description:
The Hayloft and Stables are our holiday homes that we enjoy so much, and from May 2021, we wanted to 'share' with others.

The converted hayloft is a romantic getaway for a couple , with a single sofa bed located downstairs in the common area if required. (Max 3 people).

Upstairs in the Parisienne bedroom, with ceiling fan & split system aircon, there is a beautiful view over the courtyard and ponds. (We also have Chromecast for your streaming)

The space
The beauty of The Hayloft is knowing that the Stables cottage is also on the property, should you need extra accommodation for family or friends.

Whether you are visiting the Barossa, the Murray River, the Hills, or you just want a relaxing time away from the hustle and bustle, our cottages, built in the 1890s are for you. Cuddle up in front of the lovely wood fire in the Stables, or go upstairs in the Hayloft.

The grounds of the cottages are wonderfully peaceful, wit
neighborhood_overview:
The historic hamlet of Springton, population 600, is located in an amazing location to explore the local area:

The cottages are directly opposite the Edenmae cellar door, for tasting platters and food on Friday, Saturday and Sunday

All the Barossa wineries are within 30 minutes, with the cloest being Henschke, Suffield, Eden Hall, Fernfield, Eden Valley, Rileys, Mountadam, etc

A must visit (just 5 mins away) is the Mt Pleasant Farmers Market (every Saturday 8am-12noon) - (Have a wonderful cooked breakfast there)

20 minutes from Historic Angaston, as well as Nurioopta, Tanunda (go via the Menglers Hill lookout) and Lyndoch

Take a 1km hike to the beautiful view of the forests and valleys from Mount Pleasant Summit (5 minute drive to trailhead on Glen Devon Rd)

Springton General Store and Post office is opposite, for all your food and drink (and fuel) needs (8am -6pm M-F, 9am-5pm Weekend)

The Herbig family tr
host_about: As Airbnb hosts (and Airbnb guests when we travel), we want our gests to have the best experience possible. We are sure you will enjoy either the Stables or the Hayloft as much as we do. We bought this beautiful property for our friends and family to enjoy, and when available, for others such as yourselves. If you need a break from the busy city lifestyle, come and relax in our double hammock, on the boat in the billabong, by one of the two firepits, or a night watching the wood heater in the Stables. The sound of the waterfalls, birds, and flowing water in the ponds adds to the relaxed ambience. Our highlight is to know that we have provided a place of tranquility for all our guests.

name: The Cottage at Riverside Farm
description:
A beautiful, secluded, self contained cottage in the Barossa Valley overlooking the North Para River. There are many places to walk, picnic or simply enjoy the view. All modern amenities included and sleeps up to 4 people. A couple of minutes away from Chateau Yaldara, the Lyndoch Hill Restaurant and the Lyndoch main street. Only a few minutes more to Tanunda and the other wineries and restaurants in the Barossa Valley.

The space
Unique views and park like surrounds make this a truly relaxing getaway. With virtually no surrounding noise or light sources the days are peaceful and the night sky truly stunning.

Find us at www/riversidefarm/net/au or search for 'Riverside Farm Barossa Valley' on the web.

Guest access
All areas are accessible but please leave things as you find them

Other things to note
This is a working farm so please exercise common sense when moving around the property.

name: Peaceful 3br cottage in the 🖤 of Angaston
description:
Plum Cottage is a 1940’s miner’s cottage, renovated to ensure all modern conveniences. Everything you need for a getaway to the Barossa.

The space
Enjoy heritage Barossa with all the comforts.

Bedrooms are carpeted, and each furnished with hanging space, a queen or double bed, and extra large quilt.

New kitchen includes gas cooktop, cooking essentials and saucepans – although you also have breakfast, lunch and dinner options just a five minute walk from the front door.

Brand new bathroom with shower and bathtub.

Multiple living areas for hanging out, eating, curling up with a book, or enjoying the fresh air from the large covered porch.

Sip wine from the Riedel glassware, enjoy sunset views over the garden from the living room sofa, and make yourself at home.

Other things to note
The third bedroom is a sleep-out and is semi-detached from the main house, accessed via the covered front po
neighborhood_overview:
The cottage is on a quiet local street, 5 minutes walk from the main street of Angaston and its shops, supermarket, cafes, bakeries, pubs, restaurants, Casa Carboni cooking school and the Barossa Valley Cheese Company.

Angaston is surrounded by vineyards, fields and gums. Excellent access to Barossa wineries, the Angaston to Nuriootpa cycle track, the undulating hills of Barossa’s high country, our fabulous Barossa Farmer’s market, and the multi award winning Vintners Bar & Grill.
host_about: Hi! I'm a 30-something who's recently moved back home to South Australia after time in Sydney and London. I enjoy rock climbing, swimming, reading, cycling, skiing, coffee, tea, food and wine.

name: Little Eden - See Barossa Valley & bring your pet
description:
Welcome to 'Little Eden' - a beautiful self contained cottage nestled amongst the gumtrees and wineries of Eden Valley, in the centre of the Barossa Valley.

The cottage is light, clean
and offers a cosy, quiet, yet convenient place to use as your base to explore the stunning region and it's surrounds.
And when you're done exploring, come home, light a fire or take in the cool valley air at night and sink into the couch for a quiet night in with a glass of your latest discoveries.

The space
Looking to stay an extra night - add the following PROMO CODE
to receive $200 off your third night "LITTLEEDENNOVPROMO"

With your own private bedroom, en-suite bathroom, a kitchen with modern appliances, comfy living room, Aircon , Fire place, WiFi & Netflix, this truly is a great place to escape the hussle-bussle of the city or for a young family to take that long overdue getaway where they can truly relax, enjoy the splendour of
neighborhood_overview:

host_about:
I am a family man that loves to travel and explore new places & meet new people.
I enjoy hosting guests and also enjoy being a guest whenever I travel which allows me to experience and learn about what others have to offer.
I am always working towards making your stay with us, an enjoyable, relaxing and unforgettable experience.
Thank you & I look forward to hosting your stay.

name: Flaxman: historic Goat Square Cottages in Tanunda
description:
Flaxman Cottage is one of three self-contained, connected heritage cottages in historic Goat Square in Tanunda. It features two bedrooms (with king and queen sized beds), spa bath, under-floor heating & a wood fire, and is the perfect place to retreat, relax and enjoy the Barossa Valley. Provisions are left to prepare your own country style breakfasts.

Experience intimate surroundings with thick stone walls, historic low ceilings, quality furnishings & extensive cottage gardens.

The space
Built in the 1850s, Goat Square Cottages are on the Register of the National Estate and represent one of the oldest occupied dwellings in the Barossa Valley. The space has been family owned since 2000, lovingly restored and furnished with modern facilities. As well as quality furnishings and luxurious comfort, other highlights include thoughtfully chosen artworks and fabrics, many of which support Goat Square Cottages’ commitment to sourcing local and regional product
neighborhood_overview: Your cottage is located in the historic heart of Tanunda. In times past, the Ziegenmarkt (Goat Market) was held every Thursday at Goat Square. The cottages are within easy walking distance to the Main Street of Tanunda where the outstanding fermentAsian Restaurant and 1918 Bar and Grill are located, as well as donuts and coffee at Browns Barossa Donuts.

name: Gateway to the Barossa Valley.
description:
Situated at the gateway to the Barossa Valley this fully self contained unit is on a large property amidst gum trees. It has a fully equipped kitchen, large dining area, cosy lounge with smart TV, an intimate bedroom with ensuite bathroom, plus laundry facilities. Reverse cycle air conditioning and ceiling fans throughout ensure a comfortable stay any time of the year. The private outdoor area boasts a BBQ and Webber with access to an inground pool. Wifi available. Perfect for singles/couples.

The space
This space ensures total privacy. The backyard is tranquil and filled with tall gum trees and loads of bird life. It’s close to all shops and within walking distance of a great Indian-Italian fusion restaurant. An extended hours service station with convenience store are located at the end of the street.

Guest access
Guests have their own private access to the property and their own private outdoor area. Privacy is assured. Use of the pool a
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is a quiet spacial residential area with a extended hours service station and restaurant within walking distance.

name: The Station - luxury group accommodation
description:
The Station at Kapunda offers luxury group accommodation for 10 to 15 guests in a unique environment and within a short drive to both the Barossa and Clare Valleys.
Book with confidence. A full refund will be given for any cancellations due to government restrictions.

The space
About the property…
SLEEP TIGHT
5 king bedrooms
Additional 5 single beds.
Please refer to the property plan for the bedroom layout to ensure suitability for your group as some of the rooms are interconnected.

COOK UP A STORM
The original ticket office is now a chefs kitchen with every possible convenience: coffee machine, sandwich press, induction stove, pots & pans, crockery and cutlery for all!

R&R
Relax in the lounge, the courtyard, the little book room, and the kitchen garden. And the platform – at just under 100m long – will give you plenty of space to relax or dine.

WORK or PLAY
The board/games room c
neighborhood_overview:
We think that you'll be surprised at just how much Kapunda has to offer. In addition to being only a short drive to the world renowned wine regions of the Barossa and Clare Valleys, the local area is worth exploring.

Book a tour of ANLABY STATION - a historic sheep station that has been lovingly restored including 20 acres of manicured gardens.
Explore the RETAIL outlets in the main street: homewares at KOCO HOME, plants and pots from PLANT POT & MORE, gifts and more at TINY NEST

ART & CULTURE plays a big role in Kapunda. Wander the streets to look at the award winning street murals and visit the regional gallery to pick up a piece or two.
If you are more serious about your creativity, enrol in a workshop to paint BLOOMS with Jacqueline Coates. You will need to book ahead - and hope that she is in town at the time and not in residence in Paris!

Of course - it's not far to other creative and culinary experiences:
Learn the in's and ou
host_about:
A tale of two cities... well one is more a small country town!  
I live between Collingwood on the Northside of Melbourne - and the beautiful Barossa Valley in South Australia. I love Collingwood and it's surrounds: the food, the shopping, great coffee and an eclectic community. But I also love the serenity in the valley and it is such a wonderfull contrast and so good for the soul. When I am in either location I pop the other on Airbnb so that I can share all that I love. I am passionate about design which is reflected in my homes, and I love to immerse myself in the local culture of the places that I live and visit. I know the importance of having a home to return to after a day of exploring and have ensured that I have kept my homes as truly liveable spaces.  I am proud to share them with like-minded guests and I know that you will enjoy your stay in either 'the Wood' (Collingwood), or the valley.

name: Farm View Manor Bed and Breakfast Luxury
description:
Farm View Manor, all the luxury the Barossa has to offer.

A traditional Bed and Breakfast for the lovers of hosted accommodation. The Luxury Wing gives you the privacy you need with gorgeous views of a working farm.

We are committed to providing a secluded space with quality provisions and are always happy to help in any way to ensure your stay is memorable.

Your choice of a continental breakfast, a scrumptious cooked breakfast, or cook your own on the BBQ provided. (Included in the price)

The space
We offer indulgent extras, please contact us with your special request.
Cheese and fruit platter
Antipasto platter
Homemade soup
Pre made pizza
Picnic hamper
Gourmet BBQ pack
neighborhood_overview: Farm View Manor is located on the edge of the beautiful Barossa and just a short drive to the Adelaide Hills

name: Kalimna House
description:
This comfortable house is fully furnished and self contained and is suitable for families and friends to share. Accommodating up to 9 people,. We welcome you to enjoy this lovely, quiet, natural setting, with country fresh air, close to amenities -10 min walk to shops, oval, swimming pool and bush gardens walking trail.
Check out our great walking and bike tracks - 30 min bike ride to Tanunda, Angaston.
Places of interest - Maggie Beers Farm, Manglers Hill and many winery's to mention.

The space
Spacious, open plan house.

Guest access
Guests will have access to the entire house (5 bedrooms, can sleep up to 9 guests - EXCEPT store room, back yard and shed.

Other things to note
On your home stay, we do provide a pull out washing line which is located under the outdoor pergola.
All bedding is supplied along with a bath towel.
We do provide small shampoo, conditioner and body soap for each guest.

name: Possum Cottage
description:
More than meet the eyes! Lovely original old cottage home. Underground wine cellar is part of the property, self contained, SPA room in the back yard. Very convenient to walk to the restaurant and shops, wineries surrounded. Hot air balloon park nearby. Pub opposite the road, comfortable beds, self check in. BTW, we hope you don’t mind we have a possum family resident who live there for long time but they are harmless and lovely.

The space
No parties please
neighborhood_overview: At the end of Main Street but near all the restaurants and shops;) wineries surrounded!

name: 1890 STABLES WITH WOODFIRE -BAROSSA HILLS COTTAGES
description:
The Hayloft and Stables are our holiday homes that we enjoy so much, and from May 2021, we want to 'share' with others. We have listed them for you to have an opportunity to enjoy also!

If you want a peaceful, relaxing time, and a base to explore the Barossa, Adelaide Hills and RIver Murray from, the Stables is for you. The original 1890 Stables have been renovated to reflect the bygone era, but have all the modern conveniences available - inc. Chromecast for your streaming services!

The space
The beauty of The Stables cottage is knowing that The Hayloft is also on the property, should you need extra accommodation for family or friends.

Whether you are visiting the Barossa, the Murray River, the Hills, or you just want a relaxing time away from the hustle and bustle, our cottages, built in the 1890s are for you. Cuddle up in front of the lovely wood fire in the Stables, or go upstairs in the Hayloft.

The grounds of the cottages
neighborhood_overview:
The historic hamlet of Springton, population 600, is located in an amazing location to explore the local area:

The cottages are directly opposite the Edenmae cellar door, for tasting platters and food on Friday, Saturday and Sunday

All the Barossa wineries are within 30 minutes, with the closest being Henschke, Suffield, Eden Hall, Fernfield, Eden Valley, Rileys, Mountadam, etc

A must visit (just 5 mins away) is the Mt Pleasant Farmers Market (every Saturday 8am-12noon) - (Have a wonderful cooked breakfast there)

20 minutes from Historic Angaston, as well as Nurioopta, Tanunda (go via the Menglers Hill lookout) and Lyndoch

Take a 1km hike to the beautiful view of the forests and valleys from Mount Pleasant Summit (5 minute drive to trailhead on Glen Devon Rd)

Springton General Store and Post office is opposite, for all your food and drink (and fuel) needs (8am -6pm M-F, 9am-5pm Weekend)

The Herbig family tree
host_about: As Airbnb hosts (and Airbnb guests when we travel), we want our gests to have the best experience possible. We are sure you will enjoy either the Stables or the Hayloft as much as we do. We bought this beautiful property for our friends and family to enjoy, and when available, for others such as yourselves. If you need a break from the busy city lifestyle, come and relax in our double hammock, on the boat in the billabong, by one of the two firepits, or a night watching the wood heater in the Stables. The sound of the waterfalls, birds, and flowing water in the ponds adds to the relaxed ambience. Our highlight is to know that we have provided a place of tranquility for all our guests.

name: CRUSH Guest Room & Ensuite-Hewitson Barossa Valley
description:
‘CRUSH’ Guest Room is part of the original homestead on the property over 160 years old that Dean and Lou Hewitson have lovingly restored. Stay on a working vineyard and winery in the epicentre of Barossa Valley and enjoy unbridled access to all the Valley has to offer.
Take in the unparalleled views over the vineyard while enjoying a glass of Hewitson at the Tasting Room. As a guest you have the privilege to procure wines from The Hewitson Old & Rare Museum Cellar. Just ask!

The space
‘CRUSH’ Guest Room is a contemporary space, beautifully furnished for a relaxing and comfortable stay. The King Bed has been fitted with all-natural fibre quality bed linens. The adjoining en-suite bathroom uses local Barossa soaps. The mini-bar includes super-premium Hewitson wines, fridge and kettle with teas, milk, sugar & coffee and a light yoghurt and muesli breakfast. The area comes with a flat-screen television, reverse cycle A/C and free wifi. Our guest rooms and wine
neighborhood_overview: There are great dining options available and all just a few minutes away, which we can highly recommend. Most restaurants accept BYO and please let them know you are our guest. You can purchase wine from your Guest Room and from our Tasting Room; or ask us for our Old & Rare Museum Cellar list and choose something special! let us know in advance. Reds will be left on the mini-bar and whites in the fridge in your room.

name: Rural retreat! 5 min to wineries / 10 min to town
description:
Turret Ridge is the perfect group entertainer. We have 85 acres of farmland to explore with breathtaking views over the whole valley, especially at sunset.

We’re only 10 minutes from Tanunda, (the best village in the Barossa!) and several of the most interesting cellar doors are right on our doorstep.

The space
We can easily accommodate up to 12 ppl in 5 bedrooms.

We have two large lounge rooms which are both appointed with large wood fires for warmth and ambiance.

Kids will be entertained for days either exploring outdoors or in our kids zone where we have loads of arts and crafts, toys, books and games.

Our kitchen is an entertainers dream with huge bench space, gas hob, double oven, dishwasher and loads of fridge space.

Guest access
Guests have exclusive use of the whole house for the duration of their stay - livings areas, kitchen, bedrooms and 85 acres of bush to explore!
neighborhood_overview:
Rural retreat. The only neighbours are kangaroos and the kookaburras who you’ll hear in the mornings.

…but we are only 10 minutes from the wonderful township of Tanunda.
host_about: Love to travel for work and pleasure

name: BALMORAL LODGE - EXCLUSIVE BAROSSA COUNTRY ESCAPE
description:
Balmoral Lodge is a stunning, 1920s farmhouse with all the grandeur of a country estate, exclusively for you to enjoy. Located 5 minutes from Lyndoch and 10 to Gawler, it enjoys the best of town and country. Large, spacious rooms, a huge and bright chef's kitchen with all the facilities to self cater for a large group. Bedrooms are individually decorated and 6 of the bedrooms are ensuite. The spectacular veranda is the place to be, to enjoy sunset views over the lovely valley beyond.

The space
This newly renovated farmhouse retains all the beautiful features from the 1920s and provides every comfort for modern holiday makers. From the huge, open plan kitchen, gracious dining room and elegant lounge room, every effort has been made for your relaxed and luxurious stay.
Bedroooms are large and uncluttered and with 8 suites, there won't be anyone sleeping on a fold out bed! 6 of the rooms provide king/twin options, one is queen and another is 2 singles. <
neighborhood_overview: A lovely rural area with walks to enjoy and lots of wildlife.  Only 10 minutes to the town of Gawler and all the amenities.
host_about: Julie and Peter are passionate home renovators who love travelling, creating beautiful gardens and Julie loves to attempt a little art work and photography when time permits. We share our lives with our wonderful son Scott and adored cat Leonard and love all the wonderful wildlife on our doorstep. We have been very blessed to travel to some amazing places, personal favourites being Venice, U.K, Ha Long Bay, Rhodes, Meteora, Kotor etc.....I could go on with a very long list. We are friendly people who are happy to be as involved or not with your Barossa and Australian travel experience. We have lived all over Australia and can advise on great places not to be missed, both local and elsewhere.

name: Family Cabin
description:
The Seppelts View Family Cabin is complete with a fireplace for those cold, cosy winter nights, a bathroom with spa and views of the nearby vineyards. You will also find a kitchenette with the essentials, and if you don’t feel like cooking, we’d suggest trying an array of amazing restaurants all within a 10 minute drive of your cabin!

The family cabin has a queen bed and a bunk bed that’s supplied with linen if they are booked.
host_about:
Located on 8-acres in the heart of the Barossa Valley lies Seppelts View Cabins surrounded by South Australia’s most renowned wineries and restaurants. Each cabin is self-contained with different cabin layouts to cater to couples and families.
There are several boutique wineries nearby, including Seppeltsfield Winery, which offers a cellar door and wine tours and is a 2 minutes’ walk from the accommodation. 

Other popular sites in the area include The Jam Factory, Maggie Beer’s Farm Shop and Hentley Farm. Other exciting destinations include the Barossa Farmers Market, and many more shops, cafes, restaurants, and wineries are just 10 minutes' drive away.

name: *Mattner House-Barossa entertainment heaven
description: Situated high above the township of Rowland Flat the Mattner House provides the ideal escape from everyday life and an ideal location to base your and up to 15 friends in the Barossa Valley. Magnificent views surround the cottage with sunset reflections across the Barossa Ranges simply stunning. Enjoy 6 bedrooms plus the wonderful extra feature of  a complimentary Karaoke and party room, a children’s play room, 4 alpacas living on site. The perfect family vacation is ready and waiting for you. Same day booking and check in maybe available, please message us for more details.CURRENT PROMOTION : Stay 2 and save

name: *Chateau Yaldara House - Barossa Iconic House
description: The Yaldara House is a luxurious 5 bedroom accommodation venue situated at Chateau Yaldara on the banks of the Lyndoch Creek. This is the onsite of one of the most iconic winery on Barossa, very popular with weddings, events and even just a leisure holiday stay. Originally built by the founder of Chateau Yaldara, Hermann Thumm, it has been lovingly restored to now provide you with an ideal location to base your Barossa Valley Holiday or simply hide away in the Yaldara house and enjoy wine and an escape from everyday life.  There is an popular onsite restaurant  which are very popular with locals. What is even better?  4 out of 5 bedrooms have their own bathrooms! name: Barossa house in the vines & stunning valley view!
description:
The essence of Barossa living! Fantastic valley view over the vines. Nestled in the bush but only 5 minutes from Tanunda and Nuriootpa. Relax with the whole family at this modern family home with stunning outdoor entertaining area and hot tub overlooking the valley. All the amenities set on 5 acres; the perfect country retreat!

The space
Modern family home; 4 bedrooms - master & ensuite with king bed, 2 queen bedrooms and 1 bedroom with 2 singles. Large open fully equipped kitchen, lounge with uninterrupted views over the valley and workstation for the home office. Double glazed throughout and reverse cycle air con for cosy comfort!

Outdoor entertaining area with fire pit overlooking the valley, undercover hot tub, large outdoor dining table under shade sail and bbq.

Guest access
Beds will be made up per the number of guests booked. If booking less than 8 guests, please let us know if you’d like the 2 single beds made up instead
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the heart of the Barossa, you will be staying on the famous Stonewell Road, surrounded by some of Barossa’s most iconic wineries such as Torbreck, Peter Lehman, David Franz, Rolf Binder, Greenock Creek and Seppeltsfield.

You are similarly close to many of the iconic restaurants with Appelation at the Louise walkable from the house but Fino at Seppeltsfield, Maggie Beers and FermentAsian only a short drive. For the spirit lovers amongst you, Seppeltsfield Road Distillery is just around the corner offering gin and cocktails in a stunning setting!

The property is located in the Marananga subregion of the Barossa producing the best of Barossa Shiraz.

name: Trinity Cottage - Amazing Vineyard Views
description:
Nestled on a rise overlooking picturesque vineyards, Trinity Cottage is the perfect blend of historic charm and elegance. Originally a workman's cottage you will love the attention thoughtfulness of our BnB. From the open fire place, deep 2 person spa-bath to the spacious lounge, it really is the perfect base to explore all that the Barossa has to offer.

Trinity Cottage is only 3 km from Vintner's Bar and Grill Restaurant and the Barossa Farmer's Market, held every Saturday morning.

There is a large eat-in country kitchen with an original wood stove top and a modern stove top as well. For summer nights the cottage has ducted cooling plus reverse-cycle air-conditioning.

Guests can enjoy a cup of tea or a chilled glass of Riesling, take in the views across the vineyards from the elevated front verandah or find a nook in the shaded gardens, listen to the birds and read a book.

The 1880s farmhouse offers an exclusive getaway for a couple, family or group of friends. The spacious retreat has four bedrooms, comprising of three queen size beds and one twin bedroom. name: Magpie House
description:
Magpie House is a beautifully appointed home just metres from the main street of Tanunda, location does not get better than this! Take advantage of our free private parking and step out the front gate into the town centre. Surrounded by some of the finest restaurants, bars, cafes and shopping experiences the Barossa Valley has to offer, you will enjoy exploring this charming region right on your door step.

The space
The house is set amongst a quaint cottage garden and is ideal for couples, a family or a group of friends seeking a self contained home away from home. With two Queen bedrooms and two Single rooms we are able to offer stylish and thoughtfully furnished accommodation for everyone. The house features two living areas, with a formal lounge situated at the front of the building and an open plan living and dining at the rear. The well equipped kitchen flows into the dining area and over looks the leafy garden setting of this charming home. Enjoy short or
neighborhood_overview: Magpie House is located in the centre of Tanunda. Within walking distance to the main street we're positioned just behind 1918 Bar & Grill and across the road from FermentAsian and the famous Apex Bakery. Next door to the property is the beautiful Tanunda Rotunda Park.
host_about:
Being a fifth generation Barossan I am excited to share this beautiful region with all it has to offer! I pride myself on providing a stylish, modern and clean home for guests to enjoy throughout their stay. I hope you love Magpie House and the township of Tanunda as much as I do. As I live in Tanunda I am just a phone call away should you have any questions or require assistance.
Sandy

description:
Quiet and peaceful on top of the hill, and in beautiful Angaston, this apartment has its own garage with direct access and is fully self-contained with washing machine, dryer, full kitchen and much more - perfect for longer stays or just the weekend.
If you are here to explore the Barossa and Eden valley areas, this is perfect. Just 15 minutes drive or less to Henscke, Penfolds and 80 more, or just explore historic Angaston and its wonderful bakeries, cheese shop or restaurants such as Vintners.

name: The olde Hamilton shop, Between Clare and Barossa
description:
The olde Hamilton shop is a Two bed apartment situated between Clare & Barossa Vally. The property is 49km from Clare and has free parking.
The apartment has a flat screen TV 2 Bedrooms and living room.The air conditioned accommodation is also equipped with a kitchen.

Gawler is 44 km from the apartment, while Tanunda is 35 km away. Adelaide Airport is 86 km from the property.

The space
This is a 90 sq property with a small outside area for you to enjoy. there is also a communal garden.

Guest access
You can park infront of the gate, at the side of the property. Can needed for getting around as no bus transport.

name: Manor House - One Bedroom
description:
The Manor House is a two story building .
There are three bedrooms upstairs (1 King, 1 Queen and 1 Split King), accessible via a set of stairs.
A very comfortable sitting room, fully set up kitchen (Incl. dishwasher, espresso machine) and one bathroom (shower) are downstairs. The Manor House has ducted A/C.
Car parking and free WiFi are available.
Breakfast provisions are supplied.
Dinner can be ordered by prior arrangement
The rate is set per room occupied (max 2 occupants per room).

The space
The Manor House is a historical building which was once the Manager’s and Accountant’s Offices.

name: Head Gardeners Cottage - One Bedroom - 1 night
description:
Gardeners Cottage
Located in the precinct of Anlaby homestead, this cottage was built for the Head Gardener in the early 1900s. At this time, the Head Gardener was responsible for the 14 gardeners who lovingly tended the historic Anlaby garden.

The cottage has three beautifully appointed Queen bedrooms, two comfortable lounges, a modern bathroom and a fully equipped kitchen. The building sits in its own beautiful cottage garden.

This is an ideal location for a quiet getaway while you take a ¿beautiful step back in time¿ surrounded by modern creature comforts.

The cottage is fitted with a fully ducted air conditioning system and free WIFI is provided.

Locally sourced breakfast provisions are supplied. Evening meals can be pre-booked.

Entire cottage
You will have the entire cottage to yourself

House Rules
Check in 2.00pm-7.00 pm
Check out 10.00 am
No smoking
No pets
No parties or events
neighborhood_overview:
The Head Gardener's Cottage is one of the numerous historical buildings at Anlaby Station.

It has been lovingly restored and now provides modern amenities such as air conditioning, a wood fire, TV and WiFi.

Car parking is available on site.

name: Molly's at Marananga Cottages - Country Charm
description:
Molly's suite is the largest and most luxurious of our suites. The suite is set up with a large separate bedroom, living room and bathroom which includes a beautiful claw bath to relax in. You are just a short stroll from our Greenock Creek Wines Cellar Door and the Seppeltsfield Road Distillery with some amazing Gins. A few metres further is theThree75 Bar and Kitchen at Appellations. So whether you are after a quiet relaxing stay or up for some wining and dining Molly's is perfect.

The space
Molly's suite is a self contained 1 bedroom Cottage with a separate Bedroom, Lounge and Large Kitchen. Molly's is ideal for a couple, but can accommodate an additional person on a fold out sofa bed if required (at an additional charge) Provisions are include for a continental breakfast but the large fully functioning kitchen is set up for cooking if you wish. A bottle of Greenock Creek Wine is included as well as a free tasting and 10% discount off any purchase at our Cell
neighborhood_overview:
The Beautiful Historic township of Seppeltsfield, steeped in history is just down the road.

description: You won’t want to leave this charming 1 bedroom Suite. Oscars has a beautiful Wrought Iron Bed and a large ensuite with a beautiful claw bath. Surrounded by a vine enclosed area to sit and relax. Oscars comes with a complimentary continental breakfast as well as a beautiful bottle of Greenock Creek Wines from our Cellar next door. As a guest of ours you are invited to join us for a complimentary tasting of one of the Barossa's finest wines including 10% of any purchases of wine.

Tanunda is just a short drive to some amazing eateries including Fermentasian,  Musque, Char and 1918 Restaurant.

name: ★ Lochnagar Barossa ★  ✔ 3 En-suites ✔ Walking distance to wineries ✔
description:
Situated on the picturesque Langmeil Estate on the edge of Tanunda, with its quiet streets and beautiful parklands, this large architect designed modern executive home with an impressive garden and 3 en-suite bedrooms is the perfect base for your visit to the wine capital with three excellent wineries within walking distance.

The space
Lochnagar is been thoughtfully set up so our guests lack nothing. From high speed wifi, complimentary bicycles to explore the extensive shared bicycle paths that extend the full length of the Barossa Valley. Our kitchen is fully equipped with all of the appliances you would ever need and all our bed linen and towelling are great quality ensuring total comfort for your stay.

Guest access
You will have access to the entire place.
neighborhood_overview:
Lochnagar is an ideal location - there are 6 winery cellar doors within 2 kilometres!
• Langmeil Winery
• RieslingFreak
• Peter Lehman Wines
• Auswan Wines
• David Franz
• Rolf Binder Veritas
• Lindsay Wines

The central section of the main street (Murray Street) is 1.8 km from your accommodation. There you will find great restaurants and cafes, including:
• FermentAsian
• 1918
• Tanunda Clubhouse
• Musque
• VinoLocal
• Z Wine

This architecturally designed heritage home carries all the characteristics you could possibly want for a getaway including 3 large double/queen sized bedrooms, large open living areas, multiple fire places and a beautiful north facing rear entertainment area.

Our Tanunda Cottage is the perfect place to call home in the world famous Barossa Valley

name: Kiron - Cottage in Kapunda, gateway to the Barossa
description:
A quirky stone cottage with WiFi and Netflix in a peaceful street of Kapunda. Kiron is pet friendly with a large secure backyard & doggie door. It's a 5 minute walk to the main street where you'll find a variety of cafes, pubs & eclectic shops. Kiron has 2 bedrooms & a third with a comfie pullout sofa. There is undercover locked parking, a well equipped kitchen and 3 living areas. There's also a separate loo & the bathroom hosts a rainfall shower over a deep bath.

The space
Kiron has a spacious living area with a large L shaped lounge room. There is a separate "whiskey room" for card games, a bit of alone time or mixing it up with board games.

There's a light filled office area with desk, monitor, wireless keyboard and mouse. A great space for working if you really have to!

Then there is a sunny dining area adjacent to the kitchen - this goes through to a lovely sun-room with plenty of greenery and some comfie arm chairs.
A split sys
neighborhood_overview: Robe street is a quiet neighbourhood street. You are just around the corner from the Memorial Gardens and Bowling Club. One block in the other direction is the peaceful duckpond with boardwalk and seating areas. And only a few minutes more walk and you are in the main street. There you will find a large Foodland open 7-7, 7 days/week, many coffee shops, home decorating and flower shops, galleries and even a Woodland Toys shop - where there are no battery operated toys and barely any plastics. And a 24hour service station!

name: The Winemakers - Greenock
description:
In a quaint but busy village of Greenock lies the original cobblers cottage. A winemakers Bolthole where many a night of wine tasting, blending blends and savouring old vintages have been had. A stones throw to numerous other boutique wineries, a brewery, El Estanco cafe & the pub at the bottom of the street, just a few mins walk. Three generous main rooms with polished original leather stained concrete & timber floors. Texture & patina from a rich history as the original boot-makers cottage.

The space
Rustic spaces inside & out full of character & charm. Log fire, wifi and small butlers kitchen with a pretty garden courtyard outlook in the beautiful Barossa ..

Guest access
parking off street. easy 10 min drive to most Barossa townships and a great selection just walking distance....

Other things to note
Potential noise from traffic at times due to being situated right on the Main Street.

name: Wilsford House
description:
Nestled into the vineyards and only moments away from Lyndoch, Wilsford House has stood tall and proud for more than 100 years in the heart of the Barossa Valley.
A breathtaking view of the Barossa vines and rolling hills greets you upon arrival. When you step inside, you’ll fall in love with how the grace and grandeur of years past has been blended seamlessly with modern elegance.
This unique piece of Barossa History caters exclusively for up to six people.

name: Escape to the country - ‘The Winemakers Bolthole’
description:
Eclectic mix of old & new. A comfortable escape to a beautiful & quaint village in the heart of the Barossa. Rustic floors stained by decades serving as the original “cobblers” boot makers in the in the Main Street of Greenock. An artisan village with many quaint attractions, a village store and fuel stop, a pub, brewery, cafe, gift shop and wineries within steps of your front door.

The space
Central, rustic with a touch of elegance, comfy sofas and fireplace. Barossa highlights at your fingertips…

Guest access
You have the run of the property with complete privacy, a true historic Bolthole in the Barossa countryside village of Greenock …….

Other things to note
Cars can be a little noisy at certain times, otherwise a very quiet village. Rustic and historic country experience
neighborhood_overview: Quiet family neighbourhood with wineries right in the village. Lovely garden courtyards. Cafes & eateries abound.

name: Benbullen Retreat
description:
Welcome to "Benbullen Retreat". A stunning 5 bedroom, 3 bathroom, blue-stone homestead set on 10 acres of immaculate parkland grounds in the Barossa Valley. For your own private enjoyment, Benbullen is the ideal destination for up to 10 persons. You will be spoilt with your own stunning views over the Barossa. This is Barossa Accommodation at it's best - The ultimate retreat, oozing charm and quality throughout.

The space
From the moment you drive up the tree lined driveway to the homestead, you will experience the true nature of Barossa living. The expansive house boasts a gourmet Hamptons style kitchen plus several living areas including a sun-filled conservatory. Whether you choose to dine at the long oak table or relax in the sitting room on the character chesterfields, the choice is yours. There is one guarantee - picture perfect views from every window.
neighborhood_overview: Centrally located between Tanunda and Angaston you will experience the true serenity of The Barossa Valley.
host_about: Janine and Matt currently run their own  beautiful 5 star reviewed bed and breakfast in the quaint village of Greenock along with managing the stunning Benbullen Retreat in the heart of The Barossa. Matt has worked in the wine industry for the last 25 years and is currently a Company Director in a Vineyard Management Company supplying premium grapes to Treasury Wine Estates. Janine is a nurse and together they have 2 boys aged 23 and 17.  In the last 3 years, Janine has passionately developed her work within tourism to a full-time capacity, gaining a reputable name as a high quality accommodation provider in the Barossa Valley. Janine will be your host during your stay at Benbullen Retreat and The Clyde, ensuring you have the most ultimate accommodation experience the Barossa has to offer.

name: Barossa Breakaway
description:
Enjoy stunning views of the Barossa ranges from the heart of the Barossa with all the modern conveniences on offer. This is a 1920 built and fully refurbished modern cottage on the main street of Tanunda that can provide a base for all your Barossa adventures. Relax by the indoor fireplace or go for a short 5 min stroll to explore all of the restaurants, coffee shops and bars that Tanunda has to offer. This is a safe and cozy home in a perfect location.

The space
Modernized and renovated 1920 built cottage with 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms plus living room and outdoor decking. Huge main bedroom accommodates a king size bed with on suite. Bedrooms 2 and 3 have queen size beds.

The rear of the property features private and secure decking, outdoor furniture and gas BBQ with a magnificent view of the Barossa ranges. The house can accommodate six guests with 3 beds. The kitchen is fully equipped with oven, stove, dishwasher, fridge, freezer, plates and cutle
neighborhood_overview: The Barossa Valley is a world renowned wine region featuring prestigious vineyards from some of the worlds most highly regarded winemakers. Cellar doors, restaurants and bars are littered across the Barossa  Valley for guests to tour and enjoy the local hospitality.

name: BIRCHWOOD ON BRIDGE
description:
Situated in a beautiful tree line street in the heart of the Barossa Valley. Only a short walk from Barossa's finest restaurants and cafes. Birchwood on Bridge is a stylish & private villa. Built in 1890 this stunning marble fronted villa contains 3 spacious bedrooms, large fully equiped kitchen, cozy open fire places & 2 bathrooms. The garden is a peaceful retreat with a spa, vine covered patio & BBQ area.

All bedrooms contain king beds which can be split into singles if required.

description:
Farm View Manor "family wing" is a hosted bed and breakfast that offers a home away from home.
The views are amazing, the place is secluded and is a short drive to many wineries and food venues.
You will have your own family wing that offers a queen bed in the main bedroom overlooking the farm with an ensuite, 2 bedrooms with 2 king singles in each and your own private lounge room.
Continental breakfast is provided daily in our shared dining area or cook your own meals on the BBQ outdoor area.

name: 2 Small Batch Accommodation
description: Accommodation with an environmental focus. Stay off grid, in a tiny historic hamlet. Situated between the Barossa Valley and the Adelaide Hills. This ongoing project utilises reused, recycled Nissan Huts (2 huts) to provide a cosy place to stay. 100% solar powered and filtered rain water. The rooms can be configured to suit a couple or twin share.

name: Back bungalow
description: A modern bungalow home. A huge property that is Independent and self contained. It contains a large outdoor entertaining area, indoor lounge / kitchen with full cooking facilities. Bathroom with shower and bath. Bedroom contains a queen bed and a single bed. The property is located on the main road of Tanunda but set back and is quiet and isolated and private. Perfect for a quick weekend trip and comfortable enough for a long term stay alike.

name: Spacious home in the heart of the Barossa!
description: Keep it simple at this peaceful and centrally located place. With your own private room and bathroom on a spacious green block, you will feel right at home. Walking distance to the Barossa Co-op and a short drive from all of the Barossa's must-sees. Bring a bottle and sit outside to enjoy all of the peaceful country air.

name: The Red Door @ Barossa Valley ★Vineyard View★
description:
Take in the stunning views over the vineyard, The Red Door @ Barossa Valley provides a relaxed and intimate space facing an 10-acre working vineyard. The beautiful natural landscape integrates seamlessly with the modern natural light-filled house. As soon as you walk through the central red door, you will be met with quality fittings and features with multiple large windows to capture the outside views.

Located in the central of Barossa Valley, it is closed to an expansive range of wineries and restaurants. This beautiful and comfortable house is perfect for small groups of friends and families as a lovely base to explore the Barossa Valley.

The space
This is an self-contained house with three bedrooms.
• Master Suite – King Bed
• Bedroom 2 – King Bed
• Bedroom 3 – 2 Single Beds

neighborhood_overview: The Red Door locates in a quiet neighbourhood where an expansive range of wineries and restaurants is around. It is only few minute drive to Barossa Central and some renown cellar doors.
host_about:
Roger and I love traveling, we fell in love with Australia on our honeymoon and moved to here 10 years ago. I am an interior designer and Roger is a property manager, Airbnb has helped us feel at home traveling and now we want to share this special connection to our guests through hosting Airbnb ourselves. I hope you will like our place as much as we do :)
Looking forward to hosting you!
Emma & Roger

name: Cottage with woodfire in beautiful Lyndoch
description:
Warm and friendly, our cottages ( two are available if you want your friends to stay as well!) at Lyndoch are tucked away among shady gums in an Australian bush garden setting. Close to the heart of the Barossa Valley they still enjoy a quite, rural location.

Historic Lyndoch, the Village of Wine and Roses is an ideal place from which to experience the Barossa Valley and environs, with its many wineries, restaurants, landscapes, heritage buildings and other attractions.

The space
The cottage has a queen bedroom and a double bedroom and can accommodate up to 4 guests. The cottage is self contained with full kitchen facilities, a large screen TV and a wood stove for those chilly winter evenings.

Relax on your verandah overlooking the bush garden, listening to the birds while enjoying a glass of your Barossa wine and tasty local produce.

Guest access
The Lyndoch cafes and stores are just a 5 minute walk, or of course you
host_about: As Airbnb hosts (and Airbnb guests when we travel), we want our gests to have the best experience possible. We are sure you will enjoy either the Stables or the Hayloft as much as we do. We bought this beautiful property for our friends and family to enjoy, and when available, for others such as yourselves. If you need a break from the busy city lifestyle, come and relax in our double hammock, on the boat in the billabong, by one of the two firepits, or a night watching the wood heater in the Stables. The sound of the waterfalls, birds, and flowing water in the ponds adds to the relaxed ambience. Our highlight is to know that we have provided a place of tranquility for all our guests.

name: Ultimate Barossa Retreats massages, facials, relax
description:
Our wellness Retreat in Barossa Valley is about reconnecting with yourself & connecting with others. Massages, Psychic Readings, Chakra Balancing, local wine & food and experience some Art Mindfulness too. You will be with a small group of like minded people in this special environment in Tanunda with heated swimming pool. You are fully hosted throughout this whole weekend by an expert team to help guide you to explore additional experiences you can add onto your Retreat.

The space
Your Retreat is ideally located in Tanunda, Barossa Valley. Rooms are based on twin share, with own ensuite & also includes one pampering option to enjoy, either a traditional massage or facial. Your Retreat package also includes your accommodation, welcome drinks on arrival, welcome platter and some local treats to enjoy on Saturday, Chakra balancing, oracle card readings, and also manifestation card exercises too as a group to get to know each other. name: 2 Bedroom Family Cottage - Sleeps up to 6
description: Relax with the whole family at this peaceful place to stay. Historic Lyndoch, “The Village of Wine and Roses” is an ideal place from which to experience the famous Barossa Valley.  The cottage is just a short 800 mtrs from the shops, bakery, and more.
host_about: Hi, We love hosting people at our cottages in the Barossa, both at the 1890s historic Barossa Hills Cottages in Springton, and these two bedroom family cottages at Lyndoch. In February 2022 the previous owners retired, and we have now refreshed the cottages - which are renowned throughout the Barossa as affordable family (& pet!) friendly accommodation.
